items.title: Events & Community Manager // Le Wagon
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
Events & Community Manager // Le Wagon

Company: Le Wagon

Tags:
  • Social Media
  • Digital Marketing
  • Community Manager
  • events manager

    • Le Wagon is a coding bootcamp that brings technical skills to creative people. Founded in Paris in 2014, we now have campuses in 35 cities around the world, including London, Tel Aviv, Rio, Bali and more! We have been voted no#1 coding bootcamp worldwide on SwitchUp and CourseReport with over 6000 alumni.

    Our Berlin office is now on the hunt for a Events & Community Manager to join our team. We are looking for a highly organised and sociable person, to create a 5-star experience for everyone in the batch, bring in high-quality students, and run awesome events for the Berlin startup community and alumni!

    YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

    • Be the face of the brand during internal events (open days, workshops, talks) & external events (tech conferences)
    • Enable students to liaise and create interactions through an events programme (ice-breaking, team-building, …)
    • Source speakers & organize Le Wagon talks to connect students with positive role models – top talents and entrepreneurs
    • Build and develop a qualified and engaged community of teachers and teaching assistants for our courses & workshops
    • Create, organize & promote workshops to attract potential applicants
    • Create engaging content highlighting alumni stories & batch life (blogposts, Instagram posts & stories, tweets)
    • Engage with your local community on social media
    • Send out event & content newsletters
    • Create and source LW goodies for each batch (t-shirts, etc.)

    ABOUT YOU

    • You are fluent in English and it is preferred if you speak at least B1 German
    • You are outgoing and highly sociable, and are constantly interested in the progress and happiness of every one of our students.
    • You have a good understanding on how to run events
    • You thrive on communication, both written and verbal. You are at your most happy at a party, and enjoy talking to anyone and everyone.
    • You have experience in organising events and talks.
    • You are approachable and you love helping people.
    • You are a natural, enthusiastic networker, and have a talent for public speaking.
    • You are passionate about technology, education and entrepreneurship, and ideally have an existing network on the Berlin tech scene.
    • You enjoy working in a small team with a degree of independence

    EXPERIENCE

    2+ years of experience in a community or events position with good experience of organising and marketing events (talks, workshops, social)

    APPLICATION PROCESS

    • Phone interview with Rich, Country Manager of Germany
    • In-Person / Skype interview with Rich and Nim, Head of Marketing, Germany
    • Skype interview with Reb, CMO
    • 1/2 day spent working at Le Wagon offices

    COMPENSATION

    • ~€30K per year (dependent on experience)
    • Yearly retreat with 150+ employees from Le Wagon around the world – previously Lisbon, Essaouira and Bordeaux
    • Travel to London and Paris on occassions throughout the year
    • Possibility to work remotely sometimes
    Apply for this position

items.title: Marketing Specialist, SEM, SEO
items.content:
Marketing Specialist, SEM, SEO at Zima Media

Remote | Freelance

Our team is looking for a Marketing Specialist (SEM, SEO) who has a good ability to work independently and is eager to learn new things to help take Zima Media to the next level.

In this role, you will be largely responsible for developing and driving digital marketing campaigns and strategies for a portfolio of clients.

This is a full-time contract, 100% remote position.

What you will do:

  • Manage project initiatives from conception to completion, including planning, campaign implementation, client communication and managing deadlines.
  • Complete work independently and manage a portfolio of varying clients.
  • Plan, manage and support digital marketing plans across the web (SEO, SEM, PPC, shopping, display and retargeting campaigns).
  • Actively troubleshoot and contribute to the development of new policies and procedures.
  • Dig into web, ad campaign, and customer data and execute a plan of actions based on these key insights.
  • + more based on your abilities/interests.

What you bring:

  • 0-3 years of relevant experience.
  • Exceptional communication and writing skills.
  • Well-organized and detail-oriented (it goes without saying).
  • Solid computer skills, including Google Suite, marketing software and advertising platforms.
  • Google Analytics, Google Ads, SEO, and advertising qualifications preferred.
  • Interest in technology, web, and digital marketing.
  • Demonstrable experience in marketing data analytics and business intelligence tools.
  • Experience in implementing Google Tag Manager, and tracking codes from online media vendors, such as Google AdWords, Facebook, and others, are a plus.
  • Ability to work well in a fully remote, small business environment.
  • Ability to actively learn and take on new skills.
  • BSc/BA in business, marketing, communications or similar focus desired.

We are looking for an individual who is interested in joining Zima Media in its early days and be part of the construction and future success of the company.

Apply for job

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote Looking for UX/Product Designers (and more) Hello everyone! I’m ...
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote

Looking for UX/Product Designers (and more)

Hello everyone!I’m Noel. I saved some money and now I want to invest it in some personal projects during my free time.

I need people for:* Creating logos* Creating UI/UX designs (with no user-research. I’ll do the user-research and I’ll just send you the pages/features that needs to be created)* Writing good product descriptions or product speech (you know, explaining how a feature works, and “why you should pay for this product”)

It’s not gonna be a full-time job.Every time I need to start a new project, I’ll send an email to a few of you, asking for how much time do you think it can take to finish the project (anyway, I’ll try to not work with fixed prices, but it will help to get a cost estimation).If I choose you, I’ll send you a full detail of the pages/features that need to be created, and I’ll trust in your creativity and your UX experience, in order to create them. So, you are going to be responsible for defining the UX (more fun for you) with some input from my side.

So, if you can do some of those task mentioned above, send me an email to brodanoel@gmail.comPlease, the email should contain:* Your portfolio or any kind of work that you already worked on (please, don’t bother you sending a PERFECT portfolio. Just send something)* How much time have you taken creating each of your portfolio projects? (Will be helpful to get some cost estimations)* Your rate (USD per hour) (consider that I’m not a company. It’s just a couple of side projects)

Important: I’m not in a hurry with none of the coming project. I WILL NOT request things to be done “yesterday”. We’ll have time. The job is going to be chill out.

I hope to see you there!

PS.: Please, only freelancers. No companies.

items.title: Marketing Co-Founder
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
CodePeople is a unique online magazine and authority covering the tech industry through the eyes and awesome stories of the passionate people behind it. Writing about the future has never been more optimistic, fun and human. Our ambition is to uncover awesome tech stories you’ve never heard before. CodePeople optimistically strives for a more efficient and beautiful world. We inspire and empower the most talented people on the globe to THINK DIFFERENTLY.


Why Is This Role Exciting For You


Are you passionate about technology, the latest news and developments, digital marketing and advertising potentials in our era? Are you motivated by building a new brand from ground up, growing an online presence, building engaging communities and making an impact? Would you love working for a new and rapidly growing international brand? If so, we would like to talk to you about joining our founding team.


As the marketing co-founder, you will champion our CodePeoples’ branding as well as customer and user acquisition. A prime content led tech brand which is the main source of information, dreams and ideas of ambitious people, inspiring and empowering the most talented people on the globe to think differently. You will drive growth of our brands’ online presence and authority, through seo, social media marketing and other digital marketing strategies.


Who You Are


We are looking for a passionate marketing co-founder, to drive all things marketing, from creative direction and branding to PR and demand generation with a major emphasis on content generation/marketing. As a global brand, it is our mission to clearly communicate our brands’ vision and empower our users, as well as other key Technology stakeholders and partners. You will join a high-performing team of individual founders that works cross-functionally to grow the CodePeople brand and authority in the tech industry.


We are looking for a strong marketing candidate with deep experience in digital marketing and growth hacking. The ideal candidate will have seo and social media marketing experience, can identify, direct and/or create viral content in the forms of video, audio, image and text. An outgoing personality that engages, educates, and inspires people and online communities is a must — if you’re looking for a real opportunity to have an impact on people’s lives, now’s the time to apply.


What You Will Do



  • Establish goals, strategy, measurement, and tactics for our brand

  • Develop relationships with other authority website authors, community admins and influencers in the tech space

  • Partner with other organizations to build brand loyalty

  • Engage with people on our social media and other online communities and encourage aspiring writers and techies to write content for our magazine

  • Continuously come up with new ways to empower people build new things through tech and share their story on our magazine

  • Created animated and engaging social content that naturally highlights techies’ everyday life, informational content as well as tech influencer interviews and stories

  • Create marketing activity reports including KPIs and identify areas for future improvement

  • Gather, compile, and analyze feedback on the CodePeople product and brand


The Ideal Candidate



  • Passionate about building a multi-million-dollar company

  • At least 4-5 years of marketing experience in media and advertising industry

  • Bachelor’s degree or above. Excellent candidates with relevant experience will be considered

  • Strong understanding of inbound and outbound marketing strategies

  • Past experience in SEO strategy

  • Highly proficient and very active in social media

  • In-depth knowledge of creative branding and direction

  • Analytically-minded and digitally savvy

  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills

  • Background in market research, social listening and/or data analytics & insights is a plus!


Commitment: Initially Part-time, Full time after Seed funding.


Location: We are a remotely distributed team across the globe.


Compensation: Equity only at this stage, Salary based on Seed Funding.

items.content:
At Karhoo, we are creating the largest and most transparent marketplace for ground transportation: the Karhoo Mobility Exchange.


By positively enabling ground transport around the world, with regulated/licensed taxi and PHV fleets, we will give greater variety to consumers and corporations alike, bring new opportunities and data for the private and public sector, and help to enable ‘smart cities’ for citizens everywhere.


Karhoo, the first fully-integrated global, neutral, booking platform for regulated Taxis and PHVs was bought out of administration in January 2017, funded by RCI Bank and Services, the financial services provider for the Groupe Renault brands in the world and for the Nissan Group brands.


 As we transition from start-up to scale-out mode, we are seeking a talented Technical Product Manager to work in a cross-functional agile team to own everything from discovery to optimisation as required.


Responsibilities



  • Develop and implement product strategies consistent with company vision and philosophy

  • Collaborate with commercial and technical teams on product architecture, capability, and composition

  • Work with senior management to curate product plans and roadmaps and ensuring the team delivers roadmap items on time

  • Relentless prioritisation and alignment with stakeholders to ensure products are capable of capturing the highest value

  • Build a product-value measurement framework and communicate performance to key stakeholders

  • Collect and evaluate feedback from customers, stakeholders and other teams to shape requirements, features and end products

  • Coordinate cross-functional teams and challenge the team on delivery speed and quality of the work

  • Make creative recommendations to expand product base and vision and document and refine them with the team

  • Own the full requirements life cycle (from roadmap to story)

  • Lead the requirement ceremonies for the team


Requirements



  • 3+ years relevant experience, including meaningful experience in strategic product management, product design, product development, technical product management or similar roles

  • Experience working within a SaaS / PaaS business and public cloud (AWS, Google Cloud)

  • Experience working within an agile delivery methodology

  • Experience managing technical product delivery:


    • This includes working with team engineers to develop diagrams for APIs, Microservices, CI/CD pipelines and automation strategies.

    • Able to understand Technical Architecture diagrams

    • Able to understand, simplify and document complex business flows and present them to the team.


  • Experience analysing third party APIs documentation including security mechanisms and presenting findings for the team

  • Experience writing simple queries to extract analytics or analyse logs if required

  • Organizational and leadership abilities

  • Results-oriented, positive, can-do attitude in the face of ambitious operating environment


Key Stakeholders



  • Reports to the Exchange Squad Product Lead

  • Align with senior stakeholders to ensure product roadmaps supports wider company vision,  commercial strategy and tactical market requirements

  • Align with operational teams to ensure product performance is high quality and operational and management overheads are minimal

  • Align with engineering to ensure that the velocity of product delivery is maximised whilst engineering debt is minimised


Package and Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Your own L&D budget

  • 25 days holiday

  • Pension scheme

  • Private medical insurance

  • Dental insurance

  • Travel insurance

  • Life insurance

  • Free fruit, free Coffee (an In-House barista) and a roof-top terrace in our WeWork Office in Paddington

items.content:
Description



One-to-one tuition is proven to significantly improve pupils’ grades, confidence and life chances. Yet it remains out of reach for many. MyTutor’s mission is to bring life-changing tuition to all. Our handpicked network of tutors work online with pupils from all walks of life, and we’ve given half a million lessons so far – raising results on average by one whole grade. We’re proud of the fact that over 400 schools have also chosen to work with us. And that we’ve earned a Trustpilot rating of 4.8/5.


We understand the hectic lives of families with teenagers, and our flexible lesson times mean parents can juggle schedules more easily. On our website, it’s simple to find a tutor your child gets on with – and every lesson is tailored to their needs. Also, by having lessons via live video, pupils can access the best tutors no matter where they live or when they need help. No travelling for Mum and Dad, no waiting around, no strangers in your home. Pupils can have their lessons anywhere – at Grandma’s, at a friend’s house or on holiday, so there’s no disruption in the run-up to exams.


Tuition is now more affordable and accessible, making life less stressful for those who care about seeing the next generation succeed.


 


About the role


You’ll be joining our passionate, ambitious team in an exciting, fast-paced & high-growth environment. Supporting the MyTutor marketing team, you’ll hone your skills across a number of marketing disciplines, including digital marketing, events, content and comms. Developing a strong understanding of our 4 end users - schools, tutors, parents and students - you’ll know how, when and where to communicate with them with content that will resonate with their needs. And working closely with our digital marketing manager, you’ll develop your acquisition and analytical skills, ensuring our marketing spend is both efficient and effective. Prioritisation, collaboration, and communication skills are key for this role as you’ll be working on a number of different projects involving cross-functional teams across the business.


 


What will I be doing?



  • Supporting the digital marketing manager in driving customer acquisition for parents, tutors and schools across PPC, paid social and affiliate channels.

  • Reporting on campaign performance on a weekly, monthly and ad-hoc basis offering insights and recommended optimisation.

  • Managing our tutor, teacher and parent communities on social media and review sites, responding to feedback and queries.

  • Supporting brand and PR initiatives including desk research and sourcing case studies.

  • Managing brand ambassador and referral programmes to drive acquisition and advocacy for both parents and tutors.

  • Supporting the CRM manager on email campaigns.

  • Setting up, managing and reporting on customer surveys providing valuable insights for the wider team.

  • Supporting the marketing team on events from organising large annual industry stands, to university campus events to small regional hosted roundtables.





Requirements




  • A passion for marketing, particularly in the education space.

  • Good excel and analytical skills: you will be comfortable with data and be able to identify trends.

  • Excellent attention to detail.

  • The ability to present data in a way that is easy to understand

  • A creative flair in the generation of fun and original online content.

  • Excellent communication skills and ability to empathise with different audience profiles.

  • Highly organised, with an ability to work to deadlines, and to plan and prioritise short and long-term tasks effectively.

  • Demonstrable experience of using social media in a professional and/or promotional capacity.

  • Ability to work independently and effectively as part of a team.





Benefits




  • Helping to improve the educational outcomes of thousands of young people

  • A work atmosphere that encourages collaboration and support

  • Training and investment in your learning

  • Competitive salary and share option package

  • Tuesday Breakfasts, Friday drinks and regular team events & outings

  • 25 days holiday (plus public holidays)


MyTutor is committed to creating an inclusive workplace with an EDI (Equality, Diversity and Inclusion) committee who host regular events to make sure we live up to those values. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered.

items.title: Sales Co-Founder
items.content:
CodePeople is a unique online magazine and authority covering the tech industry through the eyes and awesome stories of the passionate people behind it. Writing about the future has never been more optimistic, fun and human. Our ambition is to uncover awesome tech stories you’ve never heard before. CodePeople optimistically strives for a more efficient and beautiful world. We inspire and empower the most talented people on the globe to THINK DIFFERENTLY.


Why Is This Role Exciting For You


Are you passionate about technology, the latest news and developments, digital marketing and advertising potentials in our era? Are you motivated by leading conversations, driving your own schedule, getting things over the finish line and are driven by making an impact? Would you love working for a new and rapidly growing international brand? If so, we would like to talk to you about joining our founding team.


As a sales co-founder, you will champion our CodePeoples’ brand vertical, technology. A prime content-led tech brand which is the main source of information, dreams and ideas of ambitious people, inspiring and empowering the most talented people on the globe to think differently. You will drive digital advertising solutions sales and related products and services to the technology sector.


Who You Are


We are looking for a passionate sales co-founder to evangelize for our new technology vertical. As a trusted global brand, it is our responsibility to establish meaningful relationships with key Technology stakeholders; and manage new and existing relationships to deliver a mutually trusting and successful partnership. You will join a high-performing team of individual founders that works cross-functionally to build new technology partnerships for CodePeople.


We are looking for a strong sales candidate with deep experience selling display advertising and media. The ideal candidate will have a mix of and Sales & business experience in an industry vertical, technology and media will be a plus. Media/advertising industry understanding, deep analytical skills, priority management, stakeholder management and the ability to reach and influence senior decision-makers and a strong ‘can-do’ spirit that drives a self-starter is a must.


What You Will Do



  • Develop and execute on cold calling and email campaign strategies to qualify potential customers as a match for our CodePeople brand

  • Qualify outbound opportunities and develop a strong pipeline via phone, email or other contemporary communications methods

  • Generate new technology advertising business in targeted areas to increase our overall portfolio of partners

  • Meet monthly qualified opportunity goals to ensure company revenue objectives are met

  • Provide exceptional account management to our clients to ensure success of their programs, further developing trusted relationships


The Ideal Candidate



  • Passionate about building a multi-million dollar company

  • 3-7 years of proven success in business development and/or sales role

  • Experience in digital media and advertising industry preferred

  • Bachelor’s degree or above. Excellent candidates with relevant experience will be considered

  • Must be a results-oriented professional and self-starter, with a success record to effectively build new relationships and work independently

  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills, with emphasis on engagement, persuasion and strong closing ability

  • Curiosity and passion for engaging with local businesses, stimulating interest on their end and helping develop effective client solutions

  • Be able to make use of modern productivity tech and internet tools like either Google or Microsoft docs, sheets, slides, mobile and social)

  • Ability to manage deadlines and to operate with a sense of urgency


Commitment: Initially Part-time, Full time after Seed funding.


Location: We are a remotely distributed team across the globe.


Compensation: Equity only at this stage, Salary based on Seed Funding.

items.content:
Who We Are: 


In the UK, the average home purchase with a mortgage takes three months to complete. Through a range of intermediaries, documents and conversations, it’s incredibly inefficient and frustrating for all parties. Acre’s platform allows this process to be significantly sped up and, through our strategic partnership with the UK’s largest Mortgage Provider, we are about to launch our platform with 15% of the UK’s market going through our platform, representing £40bn worth of mortgages annually.  


We are creating the first truly digital end-to-end mortgage in the UK by completely re-imaging the process using data analytics and smart contracts on blockchain, we’ll be able to make getting a mortgage faster, less cumbersome, more certain, and ultimately cheaper.  


Acre was designed from the ground up with compliance in mind. Its private blockchain provides one system of record for every product recommendation the broker makes, alongside the justifications and documentation, stored securely and unchangeably. This record is the source for all business submission, client reporting, and commission calculation, and provides a complete history of each mortgage for compliance. 


Acre is a team of product specialists, with a wealth of experience re-envisioning legacy systems to build best in class new experiences.  


We’ve grown out of Founders Factory, the world’s best partner for founders, which brings together entrepreneurial speed and talent with big-company market knowledge and distribution power. 


Your Mission  


Will be to lead the backend aspects of our Product, working closely with our Backend Engineering team, CTO and CEO to deliver an efficient and effective product solution as we launch. 


Areas of Impact: 



  • Working as sole technical PM, heading up the delivery of the mission critical backend of our product.

  • Working with our engineering leads and CTO to help us architect complex APIs. Alongside 2 other PMs.

  • Software development background highly recommended.

  • Our APIs at the moment work within node.js express web - key migrations are in Python and the other few microservices  are in GOLANG

  • We're working with an AWS server with Kubernetes Architecture.


We’d like to hear from you if you identify with any of the following: 



  • Backend Software Development or Product Management experience

  • Experience working with Cloud Infrastructure such as AWS, GCP, Azure or any other large-scale cloud platforms. 

  • Experience delivering technical projects with backend developers.


While we think the above experience could be important, we’re keen to hear from people that believe they have valuable experience to bring to the role. If you identify with the team and mission, but not all of our requirements, then please still apply. 


What we offer:



  • Competitive salary

  • Chance to make an impact within a fully funded, early-stage Fintech start-up in a unique position to make a difference to the mortgage market

  • 25 days leave

  • Free lunch twice a week

  • Free breakfast

  • Private healthcare, a cash plan, pension contribution

  • Cycle to work scheme


Our interview process consists of an initial phone conversation, followed by a video chat with our CTO and an on-site interview, where you'll have a chance to get to know the team you'll be working with and the senior management team.

items.title: Sales and Growth Co-Founder for Mental Health Startup
items.content:
We are looking for a Sales & Growth Co-founder to join MyndUP and help disrupt the Mental Health industry.


ABOUT US

MyndUP is a platform that offers affordable and accessible mental health coaching by vetted coaches through live video.


Coaching includes: Life Coaching, Mindfulness, Meditation, Career Coaching, Therapy, Counselling and Neuro-Linguistic Programming. No need to figure out what you need, our coaches are multidisciplinary and can structure the session based on what will work for you.


We want to see the support for mental health grow which is why we donate part of our profits back to a selection of mental health charities that have close connections with MyndUP’s founders. 


THE ROLE

-The key focus will be on powering enterprise sales efforts both inbound and outbound
-As a Co-founder, you will have responsibilities ranging every aspect of the business and its future development
-Develop and implement a sales & marketing strategy and support with the future vision of the business
-You would join the current two founders and a small team of advisors/freelancers working out of co-working spaces/remotely.



BENEFITS and REMUNERATION

-A generous equity stake as well as performance-related bonuses
-Competitive salary offered at the next stage of investment.

items.title: Community Manager
items.content:
We are looking for a Community Manager (Part-Time Paid Intern) to become an integral part of our expanding start-up business, PRELO.


PRELO began with a simple idea, a laptop and the desire to create something special. Now it has been defined as a platform that has the potential to reinvent the rental living experience, and we want you to join us as we continue our expansion in the Irish and UK market.

So what actually is PRELO? PRELO is a tech company that connects a globally mobile community of renters to their perfect home. We help home-hunters search, secure and move in to their perfect home - all they need to do is the unpacking!

However, PRELO is about much more than just putting a roof overhead. At PRELO we are passionate about building inspired and connected communities. This really helps our members foster relationships and build a strong support network, not just with your housemates or neighbours, but people from all corners of their city.

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE
We are currently seeking candidates who would be interested in a flexible paid internship with specific focus and interest within Business Operations.
The Community Manager responsibilities are:

-Research suitable apartments/rental homes that meet the home-hunters individual and unique needs.
-Collaborating with property agencies and landlords regarding property viewings and tenancy agreements. -Facilitate ‘individual mover’ home-hunters to source potential housemates via PRELO ‘Buddy-Up’ process. -You will help the CEO manage client accounts as the main point of contact and ensure that our work is aligned with their business goals.
-Leverage customer feedback to drive improvements to the products and services that we provide customers.
-Full exposure to other departments within the company including Sales, Marketing and Product Development.
-Strong potential for full time and senior position as we are growing aggressively.
-You will work directly with the CEO getting exposure in all areas of a start-up business.

This is not an ordinary role in an ordinary company. This is full-on start-up mode where you will have the ability and freedom to make decisions in a split second without the need for approval after approval from management. We are extremely ambitious and plan to make ourselves a global brand which will provide you with the opportunity to see the world and grow both personally and professionally. What are you waiting for, take the leap!

Underlying Principles when working with PRELO: 
-Accountability - Are you happy to stand over the work you are doing?
-Provide Value- Provide more value to your colleagues and customers than you ask for
-Communication - transparency with your colleagues and customers.
-Respect - respect to your colleagues and customers.
-PRELO is about People, not Properties

Skills:
Empathy - can you put yourself in the shoes of the home-hunter to understand the stresses and strains of the relocation process?

Proactive – can you proactively engage with the expat, landlords, property agents and our partners to continue to streamline our service offering?

Time Management – we are in a very fast-moving environment, can you balance demands from a large number of home-hunters at any one time?

Additional Info:
-Paid Internship + bonuses + work from home
-Will range from 10-20 hours per week, but happy to work out a schedule that fits candidate
-Suitable for undergraduates or postgraduates who are interested in part time work with view to full time role in the summer months.
-Suitable for someone who wants to work within operations but also get exposure to sales and marketing. -Suitable for someone with an entrepreneurial mindset who wants to start their own business and willing to be ‘scrappy’ and get stuck in to all areas of the business.

*Remote/Part Time/Contract Roles are available for this role*

For more info contact tommy@prelo.io or visit www.prelo.io

items.content:
Who is Gameplan?


 


Gameplan is an early stage technology start-up. We are excited to be backed by some of Europe’s best venture capitalists and angel investors.


 


We are building a world-class Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) platform to make it simple to manage, schedule, time track and communicate with large workforces and multiple suppliers. We deliver powerful analytics to our customers to help them run better businesses. 


 


Gameplan is disrupting the billion dollar Facilities Management space. That means our technology is changing the way that sports stadiums, entertainment venues and major attractions globally manage their operations.  


 


We are passionate about building great products and we have loads of exciting new ideas in our product roadmap. Our founders have successfully built and exited businesses and we are now on the hunt to build out the next great team at Gameplan.


 


We are looking for a creative, intelligent and hard-working Marketing Assistant.


 


You are:


 



  • Creative and open-minded, with good attention to detail

  • A strong communicator, team player and willing to share ideas

  • Inquisitive in learning about our business, our customers and the challenges they face

  • Comfortable operating in a fast-paced and fluid environment

  • Confident working autonomously on briefs to deliver amazing work alongside our team

  • Curious to learn and not afraid to make mistakes


 


What you will be doing:


 


 



  • Designing images and digital graphics to develop and refine Gameplan's brand online



  • Helping us to develop physical materials for our in-person work (from banners and leaflets to giveaways)



  • Producing templates and creative assets for presentations, our website, digital ads (includes social, digital, CRM, mobile and media channels), and print formats from ads and out of home media



  • Lead generation and maintenance 



  • Developing engaging marketing copy to drive interest and raise awareness



  • Planning and implementing targeted marketing campaigns and exceeding both quantitative and qualitative targets for all campaigns



  • Research and report on current industry trends 



  • Managing sponsorship and tradeshows 


 


 


What you'll need:


 


 



  • 1-2 years of experience in marketing or design



  • A degree in Marketing/Design or similar



  • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud, including InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop



  • Good understanding of typography, image, colour and layout



  • Experience in brand advertising for print, digital, and social ads and campaigns



  • Some experiences in website creating pages and design



  • A collaborative working style, strong interpersonal skills and an ability to work well in small group settings as well as independently



  • Online portfolio demonstrating relevant ability and experience



  • Fluency in spoken and written English


 


 


Nice to haves:


 


 



  • You're excited about UI/UX



  • Some experience in Adobe XD, Sketch, Balsamiq or other wire-framing tools



  • Some experience with motion design and After Effects


 


 


What's in it for you?


 


 



  • Working on an exciting, rapidly evolving product



  • Your work will have a big impact on the business



  • Competitive salary



  • Access to Gameplan options pool



  • Remote working



  • Skills development fast paced startup, you won't get bored



  • An optimistic, fun working environment

items.content:
Elegant Themes

 

Strategic Partners Manager

verified
Worldwide
ElegantThemes.com is a leader in WordPress Theme & Plugin Development. We have been building the top premium WordPress themes and plugins for the past 11 years and we maintain the largest customer bases in the ecosystem. Over 600,000 website owners, freelance developers and web design agencies depend on our software and we work hard everyday to make sure we are creating the best WordPress products on the web. Divi, our flagship theme and visual page builder plugin is pushing the boundaries and has inspired an absolutely amazing community. A focus on community is a core part of our culture and it makes our work environment a truly rewarding one. WordPress is a community built on the foundation of collaboration. We are looking for a self-motivated person with a passion for business, a knack for marketing and a love for collaboration to help Elegant Themes forge meaningful and profitable partnerships with our peers. As Strategic Partners Manager, it would be your job to envision, seek out and develop relationships with other WordPress products and services. Day to day, you would use your vast business experience to come up with unique marketing opportunities, reaching out to new strategic partners and finding creative ways to drive more customers to Elegant Themes. # Responsibilities * Seek, develop and maintain profitable partnerships with our peers in the WordPress market. * Work closely with affiliate partners to help drive sales and improve the platform. * Unearth untapped and undiscovered business opportunities. * Attend WordCamps and forge meaningful relationships throughout the community. * Track your progress and provide detailed reports about partnership impact using solid metrics. # Requirements * An in-depth understanding of the commercial WordPress ecosystem. * Familiarity with popular WordPress products, including themes, plugins and other WordPress services. * Personal or professional experience using WordPress to build/manage websites. * Ability to work from home and be a functioning part of a remote company. Self-starters and self-motivated individuals only. #Salary $60,000 #Location - Worldwide

items.content:
Senior Robotics Developer / Specialist / Researcher

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Embedded Developer
Industry: Artificial Intelligence, Consumer Electronics, Robotics
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Aeolus Robotics | No office location

Technologies

c
c++
robotics
computer-vision
machine-learning

Job description

Job Responsibilities

Lead and/or collaborate in the design, development, and testing of robot algorithms, in one or more of these areas:

- Robot motion, especially reactive planning and replanning techniques, and machine learning for skill acquisition.
- Robot vision, SIFT and other approaches to both face and object recognition, vision processing in service of SLAM, and surface modeling in service of manipulation.
- Manipulation and grasping, especially software compliant approaches that are compatible with a variety of grips and objects, e.g. a cupping motion, a pinching action, and a more generic grasp.
- Hardware design, especially of compliant end-effectors. 
- ... and more ...

About you

You are looking for the place to stretch yourself, able to work within a senior, highly performant product team, and aren't afraid of a challenge.  You are a self-starter with the motivation and skills needed to effectively operate on your own time in your own way while being responsive to the needs of your team mates and the team as a whole.

You love working on the metal and/or deep in low-level or scaled algorithmic code.  You are effective at quickly understanding and operating on algorithms taken from research in AI, Robotics, and Vision, or you have have experience with sensors, motors, and other devices.  You are comfortable working alongside experts in these areas, or are an expert yourself. You have a proven track record of delivering ideas into working prototypes at high velocity.  You have commercial/agile development teaming experience. You've architected some serious systems and may have even been a team lead.

Skill Set / Experience

We welcome people with passion on designing robots to join us. Among our whole bunch of positions there may be one for you which reflects your dreams of perfect job so make sure you check every single one of them!

Flexible Hours & 100% Remote Work

You can work in one of our offices (Taipei, Vienna or Wroclaw), but most of these roles permit 100% remote cooperation.

You will work in a scrum-based agile development cycle. You will be working alongside founders, researchers, and engineers to design and build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

Whether you prefer contract work or a permanent position, we can accommodate you.

Apply now

About Aeolus Robotics

Aeolus Robotics was founded to bring the first generation of household robot assistants to life, and to market. Integrating Taiwanese manufacturing prowess and Silicon Valley AI genius, we are breaking ground in general-purpose consumer robotics with capability in unstructured “human” spaces. 

As well-capitalized start-up we have shown to the market the prototype of our robot and got additional key members and breakthrough technological approaches to ensure success in this challenging field. Search “Aeolus Robotics” on internet and you will see articles and video talking about our prototype.

Benefits

  • Roles permit flexible working hours.
  • Contract work or a permanent position: we can accommodate you.
  • Build first-generation robotic solutions for mass consumer adoption.

Job description

At eTeki, top freelance "Sr. Business Analyst for RPA " professionals assess peers being considered for similar technical roles with the respect and courtesy of a face-to-face conversation. Your feedback helps recruiters and hiring managers focus their resources on the most qualified professionals in the hiring process. 

With your proficiency in developing complex database solutions, you can make a difference to our clients across the globe. You’ll confirm interest on a per job basis and availability on a per candidate basis by using our platform and the support of a world-class team of product specialists. If you enjoy talking about technology and a desire to raise hiring standards for your profession (while making extra money), eTeki’s the right side-gig for you. 

Required Qualifications

  • At least 7-years total experience

  • Some experience with Automation Anywhere (RPA Tool) is desirable.

  • Demonstrated experience in business process modeling, improvements, process reengineering, and gap analysis (Kaizen, Six Sigma, Lean)

  • Hands on experience with the Microsoft suite of project management tools (MS-Project, Project Online, SharePoint, etc.)

  • Must possess strong communication, analytical and effective consulting skills

  • Ability to elicit requirements from key stakeholders

  • Ability to facilitate working sessions and user group meetings

  • Demonstrated ability to create and deliver executive briefings

  • Excellent organizational skills with the ability to coordinate multiple work streams, multi-task and work well under tight deadlines

  • Strong interpersonal skills and proven experience in building successful project teams and partnerships with business and technical groups

  • Self-starter with the ability to perform, manage, and lead work independently

  • Independent, self-driven

  • Problem-solving attitude

  • Readiness to learn new tools (RPA tool) and skills and share this experience

eTeki, a technical interviews-as-a-service platform, helps every organization, big or small, hire top notch technical talent by matching technical interview experts with clients who need third-party screening expertise. More information online at www.eteki.com/it-freelancing 

Apply now

items.title: Remote Ecommerce Specialist/ Digital Product manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Are you up for the opportunity of growing in one of the fastest-growing industry- e-Commerce?

We are on the hunt for high performers anywhere in the world who love surpassing lofty revenue goals and self-development as much as we do.

If you are someone who loves to win and looking to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic and fun-loving team, then keep reading... This could be the position and team that you've been looking for.


Your Opportunity:


  • Pick and choose products and selling strategies to ensure maximum profitability. Work will include creating and editing product listings, evaluating selling prices vs. buying costs, creating and executing sales and marketing strategies, among other things.
  • You'll participate in deciding the best course of action on what we sell (product selection), where we sell it (channel selection), and how we market (which strategies to use) to achieve maximum profitability. Fun stuff if you're into trading and market arbitrage. =)
  • Explore the profitability of new product lines and make sales forecasts. Work will include performing product analysis by researching historical sales data, evaluating marketplace competitiveness, and comparing against product costs to forecast profitability and make decisions.
  • Work together with the rest of the team to continually drive sales revenue and increase profitability by finding ways to improve team metrics such as total sales revenue, gross profit %, and average order value.


How You are:


• Self-starter, self-manager: We are looking for someone who takes initiative, anticipates needs, and gets stuff done consistently on time. We don't micromanage here - you'll be allowed to work autonomously to achieve goals.

• High follow-through, Responsive, and Decisive: Being a small team that moves fast, you'll need to be highly responsive in communication with the rest of the team (instant message, email, Skype). Though management is always available to resolve complex or sensitive problems, we want someone comfortable making mid-level decisions and judgment calls. Demonstrating your resourcefulness, creativity, and taking the initiative to solve problems is highly desirable.

• Grace and poise under pressure: In a high-growth business, things are always changing, and there are times when things get intense. We pride ourselves on being able to function at a high level even when things get busy by working together as a team and communicating effectively. Details matter.

• Highly productive: You're fast on a computer (50WPM or higher and you know what hot-keys are). You're always looking to optimize, automate, or find new ways to apply leverage in your life - especially with the use of technology.

• Curious but Careful: You are investigative by nature. You're curious about how things work and like "looking under the hood" and inspecting things. You do this to gain understanding, allowing you to make better decisions and manage risk.

• Competitive: You are a competitor, even if it's just with yourself. You are creative and enjoy gamifying (Yes, this is a word!) work and every-day challenges just for the heck of it. You hate losing but understand that with each loss comes a lesson.

• Positive attitude: You have a can-do spirit, are fun to be around, don't complain, make excuses, or gossip. You are open-minded and adaptable because we constantly push each other to improve and become better. You possess high integrity, the capacity to learn quickly, and high intrinsic motivation. We can teach you the rest.


What you need:

  • At least 2 years in sales & marketing and (or) merchandising
  • At least 2 years of experience in online marketing activities: E-commerce, affiliate, high- performance agency (or in-house) work.
  • Proficient in Adobe Photoshop, HTML, Excell
  • Experience with product research and forecasting sales velocity and profitability
  • Passion for learning about marketing, sales, and building a winning team.


Will be valued:

  • Experienced working in the online retail industry or retail industry
  • Experienced working/playing in a team setting, ex: football, soccer, professional e-sport
  • Experienced with utilizing software like Seller Cloud, Price Guard, Informed, AppEagle
  • Knowledge of gardening is a plus
  • You read books or listen to audiobooks


Benefits of joining our team:

  • You can live and work wherever you want
  • We love investing in knowledge and seeing our team members grow. You will have the opportunity to level up your game personally and professionally. (Think webinars, online courses, book, mentor training)
  • Performance Bonus

items.title: Product Marketing Manager (Remote)
items.content:
Locations:

Remote (US)


Job Description:

At Picus, we empower organizations to identify imminent threats, take the most viable defense actions and help business understand cyber risks to make the right decisions.


We are a fast growing startup with a great team, a validated business model and we have an amazing opportunity for global growth. Picus was founded in Ankara in 2014 and now has offices in Istanbul, London and San Francisco.


About the Role:

This is an amazing opportunity where you get to drive the messaging and go-to-market of a fast growing cyber security startup: Picus. We are looking for great energy, willingness to succeed and an open mind to create a top cyber security vendor together. We need you to learn from the experts, be the best you can be and shake the status quo!


The product marketing team (PMM) drives our communication and content to our customers, partners and direct sales teams and is essential to the overall success of the product. We're looking to grow our team to support the high growth and global expansion plans of Picus. With this role, you'll get a chance to work with seasoned cyber security, sales and marketing professionals at a fast-paced startup environment. You will be constantly challenged and you will get to develop your knowledge and skills in cyber security marketing for a software vendor.

Effective content is essential to the demand generation process for both new and install-base customers. You'll help drive development of external content including webinars, website messaging, product collateral, research studies, and whitepapers targeted at customers and partners. You'll need to keep an eye out for new trends in content, plan ahead multiple quarters for content, and execute flawlessly to ensure your content is driving demand.

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive the messaging for our offerings and keep the essentials (datasheets, web site, customer facing decks) up-to-date.
  • Develop compelling messaging that resonates with our target buyer personas.
  • Create exciting and innovative content to feed our demand generation engine in nurture streams and on social media.
  • Gain market knowledge-become an expert on our buyers, who are they, how they buy and their key buying criteria.
  • Understand the competitive landscape-understand our competition and how they are positioned.
  • Work alongside our sales channels; train them on the problems we solve for our buyers and users; develop internal tools and external collateral and teach them how and when to use it.


Requirements

  • Excellent written and verbal skills in English.
  • Strong understanding of cyber security knowledge is a big plus.
  • Solid writer and editor who can bring out the value of our technology and products.
  • Strong understanding of how to leverage social media channels such as LinkedIn and Twitter.
  • Excellent people skills to interact with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties.
  • Self-starter and strong team player who desires to show ownership and commitment to the job.
  • Flexibility and willingness to learn and work on a broad variety of tasks.
  • Proficient in using existing and adopting new business productivity tools including Google for Business and Microsoft Office


Education and Experience:

  • College degree in Marketing/Business/English related area.
  • Strong understanding of technology, large enterprise software, and cyber security challenges faced by commercial organizations.
  • 5 years of B2B software product marketing experience.

items.title: Animalz: Content Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Content Marketing Manager

Animalz is a content marketing agency that strives to create the best content on the web. We help companies—particularly B2B SaaS businesses—grow by making great content that their audience loves.

Our focus is on written content that helps companies educate and inform their audiences (Executives, Managers, and other specialized professionals in their field) on strategies and tactics for being successful in their work. Product, design, marketing, sales, and engineering are the main topic areas we cover, mostly within the SaaS/tech field.

This is a writing-focused role that also requires direct contact with customers. In addition to high-quality writing, successful candidates should be able to demonstrate strong skills and/or interest in managing customer accounts and content workflows.

An ideal content manager at Animalz:

  • is deeply passionate about writing and approach all forms of content with a creatively curious mindset
  • writes clearly, concisely, and in an organized way
  • has a marketing sense of storytelling
  • understands the business side of writing
  • is well-organized, independently motivated and loves working directly with customers
  • is fascinated by the role technology plays in our day-to-day lives and the ways it continues to shape our future.
Requirements:

For our current openings, we're particularly interested in subject matter experts in the following areas:

  • sales/CRM
  • accounting/bookkeeping
  • digital marketing
  • thought leadership in the fields of startups and SaaS
(Tip: When applying, mention your field of expertise, and choose the 3 articles that best demonstrate your expertise in that specific field.)

You should also have experience with at least some of the following, though we'll train the right subject matter expert in these as needed (which also means desire to learn and grow in these areas is paramount):

  • You are able to articulate a basic B2B content strategy
  • You can clearly explain why a piece of content needs to be written
  • You know how to do on-page SEO for any piece you write
  • You have a strong writing ability
  • You've worked directly with customers and understand the basics for handling that relationship
  • You have a good basic understanding of how content marketing, SEO, email marketing, and social marketing function (on a theoretical level, at least) and how they can work together to get results.
About Animalz

We’re a remote team with a home base in NYC and team members scattered around the world. We have an eclectic team of scientists, journalists, operations folks, and more.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company.

About the Position:

This is a full-time (40 hours per week) remote position. Although we applaud and encourage pursuing your passion projects, we want to make it clear that this is NOT a freelance/part-time position you can do in tandem with other major professional or academic endeavors.


Benefits

  • Work from anywhere you like, as long as you have regular overlap with Eastern Time business hours and can schedule overlap with Pacific Time business hours when needed for customer calls.
  • Health insurance, covering 80% of the premium for health and 99% for vision and dental
  • 20 paid days off per year
  • Unlimited sick and personal days
  • Parental leave for both primary (up to 12 weeks) and secondary (up to 6 weeks) care providers
  • Monthly health and wellness stipend (for gym subscription or other physical activity)
  • Monthly team lunch stipend to enjoy lunch with a friend or coworker
  • Learning opportunities through internal workshops, talks, and attending conferences
What's it like to work at Animalz?

Join us for an hour-long webinar where we discuss careers, growth, and culture at Animalz. We'll make sure to leave time to answer all your questions.

Grab a seat here. We'd love to have you on a call!

items.title: Toggl: Product Owner
items.content:
Product Owner

Toggl Hire is a new product soon to be released by the Toggl team. Our aim is to offer a radically new way for remote teams to hire. In fact, if you apply for this position, you’ll experience the product first hand.

Our team is looking for a Product Owner to build a new and novel hiring product.

The role
You will be a part of our development team, working with developers, designers, customer success and the management to build a fast-evolving and novel product. You will be participating in all stages of the product development process and will have a real impact on the product.

About you
You will fit in well in our team if you are a good team player and communicator, cooperative and can resolve potential conflicts productively and have some working experience with building SaaS products. Good understanding of project management techniques and software development methodologies in addition to elementary understanding of UX design are a big plus. You will be a perfect match with our team if you love collaborating with people from all disciplines, always try to look at the big picture and want to take ownership of your work.

About our team
Toggl is a distributed team of 80+ people working remotely from 30 countries. We take pride in our professional, learning-oriented and friendly working environment that values work-life balance and constantly doing our best in every aspect of our work. You can work from anywhere in the world, because we know great people do awesome work wherever they are. Every few months we travel to meet up somewhere in the world and spend some quality time together. Our business is profitable with a healthy margin and we’re built with no outside investments, so you can count on a stable working environment.

Some benefits
  • Freedom to choose when and where you work from.
  • 28 calendar days of paid time off a year, plus your local holidays.
  • 2 company retreats plus 2 team meetups a year (expenses covered) for team-building.
  • Laptop and a €2,000 budget to set up your home office.
  • Reimbursement for co-working space rent or internet service at home.
  • Opportunities to attend trainings, workshops or conferences.
  • Monthly reimbursement for gym membership, massage and other things to improve your health.
  • Support for buying a phone, eyeglasses or tools you need for doing your best work.

The salary for this position is €51,000 annually.

 
All it takes to apply is answering a short skills test. Please note that only candidates who take the test will be considered.

items.title: Inbound Digital Marketer - REMOTE
items.content: The Inbound Digital Marketer accelerates inbound leads. This job is perfect for: A skilled digital marketer who can plan, execute and monitor lead generation using state of the art marketing automation tools and techniques. We know you'll enjoy the benefits of joining our remote team. Here's what we're looking for in the right candidate: Strong aptitude for technology, SaaS, and mobile apps Able to create dynamic content with a focus on SEO and Brand Awareness in the healthcare technology market Out of the box thinker who can drive influencer relationships Skilled in web development and graphic design Networking and Social Media savvy (ex: LinkedIn, Facebook) Able to create & coordinate multi-channel marketing campaigns and related content/collateral Skilled in marketing automation Job Duties will vary and keep things interesting. but some examples of daily activities include: Create relevant content that is both enticing and increases SEO & CTA Work with sales and customer success departments to create and manage drip campaigns Produce measurable results as part of a fast-paced team and independently Strongly encouraged to apply: Clinicians with marketing skills and the desire to transition into a marketing role from the comfort of home.

items.title: SAP Subject Matter Expert (SME) MM/PP - Remote
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills: Subject Matter Expert, SAP, Configuration, MM, PP We are an international manufacturing firm with a United States presence in the Pittsburgh area. Late last year we made a decision to move to SAP. So, we are in need of strong SAP MM/PP specialist to join our team This role is a real "hands on" Subject Matter Expert role So, if you are a SAP pro with strong MM/PP experience and are looking to join an exciting growing international company, this is the one. If you don't currently live in Pittsburgh , but will work remotely and travel when necessary that will work to. What You Will Be Doing - The Subject Matter Expert (SME) is the solution expert of SAP Materials Management and Production Planning (MM/PP) modules - SME is considered as the go-to person when detailed setup or solution design questions are to be addressed on the MM and PP modules in the SAP functional area - Creation of the Functional Design Documentation (FDD) including: Detailed solution design; Test scenarios; scripts to validate the solution - Within the Operational Support process SME is considered as 3rd level support, - Act as liaison with the live businesses to: proactively engage with solution proposals; keep up networking within the respective functional area/module; ensure leveraging best practices, - Tightly collaborates with the Global Solution Architects to: ensure global template consistency, solution fits across business areas, - Supports multiple projects and BAU activities, - Reviews and supports testing of the developer code in conjunction with developers and liaises and resolves faults identified with the Data Migration - Supports Integration and Testing teams in the scope of testing cycles What You Need for this Position - 5+ years plus working experience with SAP or variant in a hands on project environment, - Experience in enterprise-level SAP projects using waterfall methodology throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success, - Expert level understanding of the SAP product suite, - Extensive experience with SAP configuration, including workflows, validation rules, and security controls, - Experience defining business requirements, writing functional design documentation, - Experience in documenting current state business processes and wireframing system designs using process flow diagram tools, UML, sequence diagrams as well as making recommendations for future state improved processes and system designs in accordance with the agreed ERP Design principles - Expert level experience defining the system architecture landscape, - Experience in designing SAP software components, - Experience integrating SAP with different business systems, as well as working with integration tools, - Expert level understanding of environment management, release management, code versioning best practices, and deployment methodologies, - Full lifecycle ERP experience in an ERP manufacturing (multinational) environment, - College or University (IT /Business) Degree, - Expert in depth understanding of business functions and SAP - specific knowledge of MM/PP - Expert SAP technical knowledge, - Expert Integration understanding, - Strong spoken and written English, - Travelling willingness 50% within USIf you are looking for a SAP MM/PP specialist , a real subject matter expert and are looking to work for a great company, this is it. Please send me your resume directly to Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume! Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you. - Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions. Looking forward to receiving your resume! CyberCoders CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire. items.content:
jsDelivr | Developer Relations/Marketing/Community manager | Fulltime/Part-time | Remote

jsDelivr https://www.jsdelivr.com/ is a free CDN for open source projects.

We are looking for active and energetic individuals interested in the javascript ecosystem and working with open source projects and developers.

Even though we are the most advanced free CDN out there, not many people know about us. Your job would be to work with open source developers, build a community and come up with creative and effective marketing ideas to let people know about how our technology can make their dev life easier.

Ideally you would be located in USA to have the ability to visit conferences and meetups to make presentations about our technology and problems we solve.

Apply at: dak [at] prospectone.io

items.content:
Imperfect Foods | San Francisco, Remote | Full-time | Software Engineer, Product Manager

At Imperfect Foods we are all about groceries on a mission. Since 2015, our services have saved over 40M lbs of food, 1.2B gallons of water, and 110M lbs CO2, donating 3M lbs of food along the way. Our software engineering team builds the ecommerce platform and internal tooling that makes this all possible. We have exciting growth ahead of us as we evolve from only produce to a full-service grocery, as well as expand our footprint to serve an even greater portion of the country. We are swimming in interesting problems around customer-facing features, scale, and logistics. If all of this excites you, come join us!

We're hiring for a few product and engineering roles:

- Product Manager: https://jobs.lever.co/imperfectfoods/df5b73c1-5019-4e83-a8de...

- Software Engineer - Backend (F#): https://jobs.lever.co/imperfectfoods/2f14d9a1-e295-40a1-a1ab...

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
• Role: Chief of Staff

  • Salary: Competitive

  • Location: Remote anywhere in the UK, with access to a central London office

  • Contract Type: Permanent

  • Contractual hours: 9am-5pm, Monday to Friday


THE ROLE


LeadPro is a software service that provides front-office support to estate agents. Every year we manage over 1.2 million tenant and buyer enquiries and support over 600 estate agents.


To reach our ambitious goals in 2020 we need a Chief of Staff to join the team. You are the sort of person who solves problems and gets things done. You will be a confidante and advisor to the chief executive officer as well as a liaison to key clients and partners.


 


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



  1. Research and executive assistance to the CEO

  2. Booking appointments and managing the diary of the CEO, including all meeting administration, accommodation and travel requirements

  3. Coordinating company events, panels, breakfasts, lunches and dinners etc

  4. Develop domain knowledge by learning how the property industry works

  5. Maintaining and developing the CEO’s relationships with media and press contacts.

  6. Aiding in communication to shareholders & investors.

items.title: Global Product Manager – Digital Health
items.content:
Global Product Manager – Digital Health

United States, Minnesota
Company: MedTech Startup

Overview

We are a digital health MedTech startup and we have developed a wearable technology that is revolutionizing the treatment of Parkinson’s disease. Our company is backed by global investors. Our technology is FDA cleared and approved in the EU and Australia. We are currently pursuing CFDA approval in China. Here is the problem we are trying to solve with this position… Reporting to the Senior Vice President of Global Marketing and Business Development, our Marketing Lead is responsible for owning all product management strategy. This includes both long-range product planning, product launch planning, and short-term tactical execution. The ability to collaboratively develop and manage timelines and milestones is a prerequisite. This position will collaborate closely with R&D on the launch of new products, influence manufacturing and clinical operations, serve as the market expert to guide key internal business processes, actively support the field sales force, and lead product adoption globally while managing internal and external relationships. Our Marketing Lead will also own responsibility for the management and achievement of budgets, forecasts, training plans, and strategic scope of product offering. What does this position look like? Remote position Reports to Senior VP of Global Marketing and Business Development Occasional travel to Minnesota and Australia Cross-functional collaboration to drive product marketing strategies Weighted towards upstream marketing initiatives (exposure to downstream activities) What is needed for success? Upstream product management/marketing experience in medical devices Experience with neuro medical device technology and software application development Product launch experience Familiarity with Parkinson’s Disease or other neurodegenerative conditions and movement disorders Startup, “roll-up-your-sleeves” mentality – Opposite of corporate All details will be shared via email and phone after we receive your resume.

Apply for job

items.title: Business and Marketing Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
This is a fantastic opportunity to make a difference by sharing knowledge, opening up employment law to the average person and bringing legal services up to date using tech. Monaco Solicitors was recently shortlisted in the Law Society Excellence Awards for innovation in technology.


 


You’ll be working with a dynamic and forward thinking team, with teamwork and open discussion, especially for problem solving. We also really encourage health and wellness and 9-5.30 working hours. 


 


Monaco Solicitors has a reputation as a highly competent, efficient, professional and friendly law firm. Our work has been featured in The Independent, The Lawyer, The Gazette and The Financial Times. It's also very rewarding acting only for employees, and levelling up the playing field in this way.


 


As the Business and Marketing Manager you will report to and consult with Alex Monaco CEO of Monaco Solicitors (MS), to achieve the following goals and objectives: 


 


 


1.Financial performance:


 


Oversee the financial performance of MS and ensure the firm’s continuing financial profitability. Including monitoring and coordinating:


 



  • Income and expenditure

  • Staff costs

  • Capacity and workflow of the lawyers 

  • Accounts, payroll, VAT and other financial outgoings.

  • Debtor chasing.

  • Sales process.


 


 


2. On and off-site digital marketing:


 



  • Managing the SEO, PPC, Content & Social channel specialists.

  • Gathering feedback from website users.

  • Liaising with the website design and development team to implement changes to the site.

  • Liaising with the lawyers to coordinate their business development tasks.

  • Other marketing opportunities.


 


 


3. Staff leadership and management:


 



  • Managing and leading a small team of administrators, marketing people and  lawyers to achieve the above.

  • Identifying any gaps in staff capabilities and either to train existing staff, or recruit new staff who have  the appropriate profiles.


 


Skills Required



  • Adwords experience

  • Analytics experience

  • SEO experience

  • Management experience


 


Nice to have



  • Agile project management

  • Delivering financial goals

  • Sales

  • Content writing


 


Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Pension scheme

  • Opportunity to work from home 

  • Unique office space (converted multi-storey car park in Peckham

items.content:
Full Time Digital Marketing Coordinator

 “Established international software as a service (SaaS) company with exceptional growth and prospects. Beat the daily commute, work from anywhere in the world” 

About The Role 

Reporting directly to CMO, this position is a rare opportunity to join a small successful team tasked with executing the latest proven marketing techniques for a well-established high growth SaaS company. You’ll be working alongside great people, world-class digital marketing resources, including agencies who are focused on driving growth from multiple digital and social channels. This is a unique opportunity to learn from the best and grow your modern marketing career. You will coordinate and execute marketing campaigns across a variety of channels, including email, web, social and PPC. 
 
Your responsibilities will be: 
 
  • Work on developing our social media community 
  • PPC channel development, testing and reporting 
  • Email drip campaign development, testing and reporting 
  • Newsletter subscription maintenance and reporting 
  • Landing page development and AB testing 
  • WordPress general website updates 
  • YouTube channel content coordination 
  • Actively participate in the development and delivery of marketing solutions for the business as demand grows 
  • Work closely with our internal teams and partners to ensure the best results across all campaigns 

About You 

  • You are an enthusiastic marketing coordinator who is looking to grow their career through the delivery of metric-driven social, PPC and content marketing campaigns 
  • You will already have experience in working across multiple channels and are hungry to learn, develop, test and then apply new marketing techniques 
  • You love building landing pages that convert 
  • You are self-driven and enjoy working consistently to the best of your abilities 
  • You have excellent verbal and written business English skills 
  • You are a good team player and communicator 
  • Ideally, you’d have gained your experience working for a software company servicing clients on a global scale 

About The Company 

MyHub is a well-established New Zealand headquartered SaaS provider of intranet solutions for businesses all over the world. Having a unique product offering with a competitive price point, MyHub is poised for continued exceptional growth. 

We operate a 100% remote working policy with people based in the US, New Zealand and Europe. The company doesn’t just pay lip service to work-life balance, we live it every day, with flexible time throughout the day, to balance work and family commitments. All we ask is that you overlap with the New Zealand based team for a few hours a day.

items.title: Inbound Digital Marketer - REMOTE
items.content:
The Inbound Digital Marketer accelerates inbound leads.


This job is perfect for: A skilled digital marketer who can plan, execute and monitor lead generation using state of the art marketing automation tools and techniques.


We know you'll enjoy the benefits of joining our remote team. Here's what we're looking for in the right candidate:


  • Strong aptitude for technology, SaaS, and mobile apps
  • Able to create dynamic content with a focus on SEO and Brand Awareness in the healthcare technology market
  • Out of the box thinker who can drive influencer relationships
  • Skilled in web development and graphic design
  • Networking and Social Media savvy (ex: LinkedIn, Facebook)
  • Able to create & coordinate multi-channel marketing campaigns and related content/collateral
  • Skilled in marketing automation


Job Duties will vary and keep things interesting. but some examples of daily activities include:


  • Create relevant content that is both enticing and increases SEO & CTA
  • Work with sales and customer success departments to create and manage drip campaigns
  • Produce measurable results as part of a fast-paced team and independently


Strongly encouraged to apply:

Clinicians with marketing skills and the desire to transition into a marketing role from the comfort of home.

items.title: Senior Backend Developer - Social Media Start Up - Fully Remote Option
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=27, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=6}
items.content:
An amazing social networking start up is looking for a Senior Backend Developer (with Cognito, Node.js and PHP) to come and join their exciting venture and growing tech team in Central London.

You'll be helping build, improve, develop and shape the technology platform as the company grows.

This is a truly unique opportunity to work for a true entrepreneurial business working with cool tech and promoting and amazing social concept for social good with the trust and autonomy to work from home 80% of the time.

As the Senior Backend Developer, you will naturally be a self-starter who is able to develop and maintain functional and stable web applications to meet specification, you will also be someone who is passionate about developing and improving applications and able to share your excellent programming skills and knowledge to the rest of the team.

Required Skills

  • 3+ years' experience of working as a Backend Developer
  • Solid experience with Typescript & Node.js
  • Demonstrable practical knowledge with MySQL & NoSQL
  • Experience integrating OAuth API's
  • Excellent understanding of the entire web development process and application lifecycle
  • Experience with Micro service development
  • Experience working within AWS (Cognito) - this is mandatory.

Bonus

  • Experience with the following; PHP, DynamoDB, Cognito and server less development
  • Experience working on social network projects
  • Experience with pipeline tools CI/CD (Jenkins /CircleCI / Github Actions)

This is really an amazing opportunity to work in a truly autonomous role, you will have the freedom to work from home or even remotely e.g. should you be successful you will be working 1-2 days a week in the office then the remainder will be remotely.
