items.title: Digital Health Coach (Remote - Kentucky) - Omada
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Note: Please only apply to one of our "(Remote - Kentucky)" positions to be considered. The start date for this role will be in the first week of January 2020.

Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and engage people in lifelong health, one step at a time.

We're hiring digital health coaches for a work-from-home position. We are looking for individuals with previous health coaching, life coaching, or weight loss coaching experience, but most importantly, we're looking for all-around tech-savvy, intelligent, empathetic, and efficient people who have a commitment to helping Omada define and advance digital health coaching.

Your role is to guide participants through Omada's 16-week online program to help them avoid progression to obesity-related chronic diseases. You will be fully supported by our online platform, which includes a detailed curriculum and technology to help track participants' progress. You will leverage this cutting-edge platform to strategically coach participants through our program, using data science to inform outreach methods during moments that matter. Your primary responsibilities will include private messaging participants through our platform and facilitating conversation on a group board. Additionally, you will actively collaborate with our Clinical, Data, Product and Operations teams to discover and drive digital health coaching best practices.

The work will be done remotely from your home using an Omada-provided computer. You will be required to attend several remote meetings per week which are held during business hours (9 AM - 5 PM); additionally, some travel will be required for quarterly in-person team meetings.

You will love this job if you have/are:

The ability the translate face-to-face interactions to the digital world A compassionate and empathetic "people person" A strong commitment to participant privacy Excited to be at the intersection of healthcare and technology Proven technical ability and a high level of tech savviness A firm grasp on effective and efficient communication through digital platforms A fast learner and are able to adapt to a constantly changing environment Committed to Omada's mission and the lifestyle changes we inspire Minimum education: Bachelor's degree

Key Requirements:

Must possess an active Diabetes Educator license through the Kentucky Board of Licensed Diabetes Educators Available during business hours (9 AM - 5 PM) Monday - Friday

Bonus:

Successful digital health coaching experience Possess an active Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP) Lifestyle Coach certification Possess an active Registered Dietitian (RD) or Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (RDN) certification through the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR)

Benefits:

Competitive salary Flexible vacation plan Parental leave Health, dental, and vision Allowance for home office setup Stipend for professional development Two giftable Omada enrollments per calendar year

About Omada Health: We've pioneered digital behavioral medicine: an innovative approach to tackling the growing epidemic of type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and obesity. Our online programs combine world-class science, technology, and design to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. Named one of Fast Company's "50 Most Innovative Companies in the World," our team includes passionate and talented individuals. Our approach has been embraced by major employers across the country, including Costco and Iron Mountain, as well as leading health plans, such as Kaiser Permanente and BlueCross Blue Shield of Louisiana.

We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.

items.title: eCommerce Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=24, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
eCommerce Manager at How to Cake It

Remote

——————————

Do you want to help people who are passionate about baking/sweets, who love learning, desire a creative outlet and often feel a bit different than everyone else? Are you passionate about all things eCommerce? Come be the cherry on top of our growing team as we strive to create a positive impact on our community of 8 million + cake lovers.

Location: Remote – Toronto, and EST preferred
Comp range: $70K-$75K

Our Mission:

We help create IN-clusive content, experiences, and products that surprise and delight, improve skills and keep customers laughing along the way. We will know we are successful when our community consistently lets us know we add value to their lives, and when How To Cake It is a premier, global brand where baking meets entertainment.

Why this role exists: 

The eCommerce Manager is responsible for the day-to-day management and optimization of all things eCommerce including but not limited to the maintenance and optimization of: the website, membership services, customer experience, eCommerce operations, fulfillment and logistics, product development and catalogues, product packaging, participation in online marketplaces (like Amazon) and select marketing and business development projects (trade shows, wholesale/ retailer partnerships).

What’s in it for me?

We are a content and product brand with an audience of over 8M people and growing. The potential for eCommerce growth is incredible given that we have barely scratched the surface and been focused on testing, iterating, and getting our feet wet. If you are excited about not only making a major impact within a company but a positive impact on the lives of our community this job is for you.

—

Required Experience: 
  • Previous project management and execution experience
  • Must have a minimum of 3 years experience in managing an eCommerce site and have touched everything from product development to delivery
Objective Outcomes: 
  • Manage and consistently optimize all things eCommerce!
  • Ensure that all department activities lead towards the accomplishment of our overall client-centric mission and department KPIs
  • Become an SME in eCommerce – and in our members and clients –  in order to create the most value for our community and grow the eCommerce department
  • Oversee and constantly enhance the entire customer journey and experience – from landing page to check out, delivery, retention and resell
  • Own and maintain our website so that it remains one of the fastest, most responsive, easiest to navigate and most importantly, frictionless/conversion generating eCommerce sites around!
  • Assist in the creation and delivery of products, packaging, and experiences that provide value for our members’ clients and encourage high adoption
  • Remain in constant contact and communication with the Director of Operations & Marketing, Head of Content and third parties (fulfillment team) to stay current on customer needs and delivery experience
  • Test and optimize department initiatives and industry best practices and track/analyze data to report and provide insight for further optimization
Core Competencies + Skills:
  • Eat, sleep and breathe eCommerce – Be passionate and hungry to learn everything about this industry
  • Product and customer-centric – i.e. obsessed with the quality of our product offering, and with improving the lives of our customers
  • Resourceful – Adept at using data and customer feedback to help pivot quickly and implement strategic cost-effective solutions to technical and operational challenges
  • Highly computer and tech-literate – can easily jump between building spreadsheets (AT), to managing the back-end of Shopify, to punching up graphic designs if need be
  • Relationship building, liaising and communication skills – have experience working with graphic designers, developers, 3PLs/ fulfillment companies, communicating with customers,  etc. (Understands tech/web/operations design speak)
  • Excited to deliver a fun, valuable, quality customer experience from the website experience, through purchase, delivery and resell
  • Enjoy creating content, products, and experiences that move people, and that brings levity and joy to their lives
  • Highly creative problem solver – looks for solutions and opportunities to add value
  • Managing and working with a variety of people on projects
  • Enjoys day-to-day maintenance and optimization of a website and other customer journey touchpoints
  • Proficient with Shopify, AT, Process Street, Google Analytics and GSuite
Personal Attributes: 
  • Empathetic
  • Self-motivated
  • Confident
  • Passionate
  • Flexible
  • Ability to remain calm under pressure

Location: Remote – Toronto, and EST preferred

Apply for job

items.title: Content Marketing Manager - Cryptowatch
items.content:
Kraken Digital Asset Exchange

Content Marketing Manager - Cryptowatch


Worldwide
The Content Marketing Manager on the Cryptowatch team will be responsible for creating content about trading, finance, and crypto that engages an audience of smart traders who utilize interfaces and APIs to monitor markets and execute trading strategies. This person will work closely with Product, Marketing, and Business Operations to learn about our audience and produce content that cements the legitimacy of the Cryptowatch brand and platform in that audience's eyes. This role will focus primarily on writing content for organic traffic generation, with a keen eye for SEO-inspired strategies and an intuitive understanding of the hot topics in crypto/trading/finance at the moment. You will play a major role in the growth of Cryptowatch as the epicenter of the crypto trading world. In addition to creating content, you will need to deftly distribute that content across multiple channels with a voice that fits our “brandless” persona. You will move seamlessly between strategy and execution rapidly with the goal of educating traders on market trends, trading strategies, and use cases for Cryptowatch with the ultimate goal of compounding the growth of quality traffic to the platform. Success in this role requires a strong grasp of trading fundamentals and the crypto markets, a love for producing content, and an ability to spot subjects that matter to our audience. We work remotely, so strong self-management skills are a must. At Kraken, you will have an opportunity to grow a one-of-a-kind product in a fascinating intersection of finance and technology with a truly global team. # Responsibilities * Understand and carry the modest, direct, and low-profile branding of Cryptowatch through every interaction we have with customers; work with Product to ensure that voice and tone are consistent in all communications. * Create instructional content to help clients understand why they should use Cryptowatch and how they can leverage it most effectively. * Produce long form, deep analysis on the crypto markets in the right tone for the brand, and launch cross-channel campaigns to promote that content. * Generate content ideas using search engine and social media research, as well as your own knowledge of the trading and crypto spaces. * Build partnerships with key brands and influencers in the trading and crypto spaces to get Cryptowatch in front of as many potential clients as possible. # Requirements * 2+ years of experience in a similar content marketing, user acquisition, digital marketing, affiliate marketing or social media management role. * 2+ years of experience actively trading (monitoring the markets and making informed trades at least once a week), either with a firm or on your own. * Proven experience leveraging content to increase revenue, without paid spend. * Entrepreneurial and resourceful - come to the table with ideas, inform them with research, publish the ones that fit with the brand, and promote the ones that perform well for the bottom line. * Experience working with data visualization and web analytics tools like Grafana and MixPanel, as well as automation tools like Zapier, Reddit bots, Buffer, etc a plus. #Location - Worldwide

items.title: Marketing and Content Executive
items.content:
About Motley


Motley is a direct-to-consumer disruptor jewellery brand, fuelled by a unique supply chain model, which is shaking up the antiquated jewellery industry. We bring the world's best fine jewellery designers to the middle market by outsourcing design and taking production in house – think made.com of jewellery. We've already been touted in Vogue as one of the hot fashion-tech businesses to watch out for. So come join the uprising.


 


Our journey so far


Motley is at the most exciting phase of its growth to date. We launched in October 2018, are currently closing a venture-backed seed fundraising round, and have huge aspirations to become the global jewellery brand for the 21 st century. We're looking for someone to be a crucial part of that early journey with us (the seventh member of the team); who's up for the rollercoaster road of the early stage start up; and who genuinely wants to be part of disrupting an industry that's ready for a shake-up.


 


About The Role


As Marketing and Content Executive you will be responsible for copywriting, social media management and content creation across Motley’s marketing channels, showcasing the brand in all its glory


 


You Will



  • Write exceptional content for all marketing channels, consolidating the Motley tone of voice ensuring campaign messages are on brand, succinct and informative (we love a pun, and a clever one at that)

  • Plan and schedule social content across our key channels, Instagram, Facebook and Twitter, engaging with our community in a timely and interactive way

  • Support our influencer outreach programme, helping to build a collaborative network of like-minded influencers with a focus on driving revenue

  • Liaise with our PR agency, supporting with press loans, releases, content and day-to-day communications

  • Producing brilliant, insightful and well researched editorial content for the Motley blog and third party sites, optimising for SEO in a seamless way

  • Support the marketing efforts and wider team across all platforms with each new marketing campaign or activation


 


About You


We know brilliant people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn't be surprised if you have:



  • 1-3 years experience in a social content or copywriting role, be it inhouse for a brand, for an agency or publication - although we’d also welcome a talented grad with great work experience

  • A creative flair with words and an appreciation for good imagery and aesthetics. You like to push the boundaries and take risks when copywriting, and are confident adapting to audience and channel

  • Experience using a breadth of marketing channels, including, social media, email marketing and PR

  • Knowledge and hands on experience of social media platforms and their nuances

  • Experience of working in an early stage start up or consumer brand

  • Experience building relationships with influencers and content creators would be a plus


 


Who You Are




    • You’re naturally inquisitive and are always looking to learn

    • You have a positive outlook with a can-do approach 

    • You’re happy to take responsibility and own tasks, while thriving in a team environment

    • You are open minded and flexible – you're happy to respond to changing circumstances and priorities while keeping a cool head

    • You're passionate about revolutionizing an industry and believe in the Motley vision that jewellery can be done better

    • You're an all round nice person. A quality not to be underestimated

items.title: Product Designer [REMOTE] at Clevertech
items.content:
Product Designer [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

user-interface
user-experience
sketchapp
product
enterprise

Job description

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

What you’ll do:

  • Create high quality design solutions from concept to production – from concept to wireframe, to mockup/prototype, to production
  • Design user flows, interaction, and pixels to turn complex data and content into simple and intuitive experiences
  • Work closely with development team to ensure technical feasibility of design
  • Confidently communicate daily with clients to understand and deliver requirements
  • Manage your own workflow to meet the deadlines which you will have set with your team to ensure success

What is Required:

  • 5 years experience developing digital products across a variety of mediums, including web and mobile
  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Product Design, or related design field (or applicable experience)
  • You understand good UX and good UI and what that means and love to create successful designs (that delights customers)
  • You have participated in the full design cycle to deliver world class, pixel perfect designs.
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong understanding of the agile software development process
  • Excited by ambiguity and rapid changes common in early-stage product development

Our Benefits
We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community



How We Work
Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work


Getting Hired
We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech Culture Video




Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

items.title: iPresence: Digital Marketing Manager
items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager

 
We're an adult classified website based in Canada looking to find a Digital Marketing Manager who can manage and oversee the growth of our company


Maybe you're a fit for our team?



About us


We're one of the largest classified sites in the world, and we’re proud of it. Expect a fast-moving culture with a no-bullshit style. We also like to have fun. Sometimes by flying in the entire team to Thailand :).


We're a flat and fully remote organization, so you'll be working with a lot of the core team members directly.



Responsibilities
  • Scoping out and seeing through cross-channel marketing campaigns based on your areas of expertise
  • Planning a content calendar across email and our blog
  • Working with team members to plan, schedule & execute the launch of various marketing assets. From emails and blog posts, to paid campaigns & SEO
  • Reviewing & editing public facing copy across landing pages, emails & blog posts


Your role

As the Digital Marketing Manager you’re tasked with managing & executing marketing campaigns that’ll help us move the needle on some of our most important KPI’s - mostly user acquisition.

You’ll be leveraging a remote team of in-house staff, freelancers and agencies to make this all happen.

You should have experience with the following...
  • Setting up and tracking projects using tools like Asana and Jira.
  • Running cross-channel marketing campaigns using email, paid advertising, seo, content & more
  • Working with digital-first companies -- marketplaces, apps, SaaS, fintech & more are a great fit
  • Adult industry experience would be great, but not necessary

Benefits

Competitive Salary

items.title: VP Product Marketing
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
The VP Product Marketing is a pivotal, demanding and broad role. At its core, product marketing & content is responsible for 6 key growth drivers for the business. Sales armoury, market knowledge, business positioning, thought leadership, new product GTM strategy and customer research, education and engagement.


As VP, you will lead a small, but extremely capable team across product marketing, content and brand. You will have multiple Senior management stakeholders (CMO, CRO, CCO & CPO) who are reliant on your speed and quality of execution. Your primary focus will be to develop compelling and simple value-based product content for use across multiple channels, including the website and sales materials and will develop the themes and supporting proof points to use in demand generation and awareness campaigns. You will also be an evangelist for Triptease and the direct booking movement. This will involve speaking at events, interacting with clients, prospects, partners and hotel tech media. 


You will become an indispensable resource to our sales teams by providing insight into customer needs, competitors and market dynamics as well as by creating compelling and effective materials and content to support the sales process.


The ideal candidate will have led product marketing functions previously and executed rapid GTM programs, content strategy, brand development and sales enablement at a high level. To thrive in the role you need to have exceptional attention to detail, the unique ability to create the simple resonating message from the complex narrative and a willingness to embrace our culture of Rocketship, Obsessive learning, One Team and Customer Wow.


Responsibilities will include:



  • Craft compelling messaging and positioning for internally and externally facing product collateral, including demo videos, data sheets, 1 pagers, FAQ, sales decks & blogs.

  • Deeply understand our customer audience and their needs, market dynamics, competitors and product levers to help grow the business.

  • Build and validate value propositions, messaging, proof points to drive internal and external simple business narrative.

  • Lead the content and editorial strategy to continue our dominant thought leadership position within hotel technology and the direct booking movement.

  • Design and plan the Go To Market strategy across departments and take ownership of the ready to sell phase of the launch.

  • Own the brand direction brand equity. 

  • Deep dive into platform usage to identify drop off areas, feature engagement and other insights to inform campaigns to develop to drive customer education.

  • Answer the question why? Why should a customer buy our product. What problem does our solution solve. How do we fix a customer problem.

  • Run point on the GTM process to enable and collaborate across all departments.

  • Dive into the win /loss analysis and pull out clear opportunities for future growth and changes to our product direction and sales messaging. 

  • Own all digital packaging and potential sales touch points such as website, event presentations and sales pitches.

  • Identify triggers and signals that indicate propensity to churn or clients happiness and work with product squads to develop messaging, products and comms to react.

  • Build content to land a differentiated story with compelling business value backed by customer evidence.

  • Meet with 100's of customers. Build relationships and maximise direct feedback into our product and sales strategies and tactical execution. 


What you’ll need:



  • 8 years’ relevant experience with at least 4 in Product Marketing, ideally within a B2B SaaS business

  • Proven product marketing expertise 

  • Excellent presentation and written communication skills.

  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate and work cross-functionally effectively.

  • Credible in front of customers, Senior Management and Product leadership

  • Work virtually with teams spread across NORAM & APAC

  • Ability to deal with short-term priority changes while maintaining a long-term perspective on department and company objectives.

  • Focus on solving customer problems

  • Articulate complex information into simplistic soundbites

  • Thrive in ambiguity

  • Strategic thinking balanced with tactical execution

  • Ability to act decisively 

  • Opportunistic 

  • Persuasive 

  • Analytical with strong attention to detail


What we offer:


We're a well looked after bunch, with excellent benefits including...



  • A competitive salary and meaningful equity

  • Regular salary reviews - we reward great work

  • A self-development allowance to spend on what you want

  • Fun events for Tripteasers – the entire company went to Madrid for our Xmas party

  • Free lunch Fridays as part of our Learning Lunches


We're a diverse group of people and we want to continue to attract and retain a diverse range of people into our organisation. We're committed to an inclusive and diverse Triptease! We do not discriminate based on gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, civil or family status, age, disability, or race.

items.content:
Search Analyst, Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures at Goodway Group

Remote

CvE

National, United States

Description

The SEM Analyst will research, plan, build and manage campaigns for Goodway’s paid search offering. The SEM Analyst should be able to independently advise on SEM planning & execution that aligns with the advertiser’s overall objectives. The ability to think creatively and strategically is essential and he or she should be able to draw upon prior knowledge & experience in order to support a variety of different industry verticals. The SEM analyst will work primarily to support internal sales and operations teams but will also need to work directly with clients on more involved issues. His or her primary function will be to ensure that all campaigns exceed established performance and service benchmarks by expertly managing the entire campaign life cycle.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • Research and create paid search proposals/IOs that incorporate appropriate spending levels, CPC estimates, and keyword recommendations.
  • Research and prepare launch docs containing keywords, recommend ad-group strategy, ad copy, and any other campaign-parameter recommendations specific to a situation as needed.
  • Launch campaigns via AdWords and Bing that are structured in alignment with client goals.
  • Manage bid and keyword optimizations and budget throughout life of campaign to achieve the best use of the client’s budget based on desired user actions.
  • Proactively contribute meaningful insights and recommendations on all campaigns to improve performance.
  • Accurately define KPIs, performance goals and benchmarks for clients.
  • Create & pull reports using various reporting platforms such as AdWords, Bing or Tableau.
  • Organize and maintain all important job-related documents on Goodway’s shared drive (VPN).
  • Prepare weekly job summaries for team calls and any other ad hoc reporting required to communicate campaign performance.
  • Contribute to Goodway’s knowledge base by updating and sharing information via Confluence and Yammer.
  • Serve as the main SEM point of contact for Goodway sales teams on dedicated accounts and have occasional client contact.
  • Stay up to date on the evolving offerings within the SEM landscape.
  • Perform any other tasks as required to successfully manage accounts or support the overall SEM team.

Qualifications

  • Minimum 3 years of paid search experience
  • Strong ad-copy development skills and knowledgeable of overall search strategy for a variety of industry verticals and campaign types

Proficiency in:

  • Google Ads (certification required) and Google Ads editor
  • Bing AdCenter
  • Google Analytics
  • 3rd party search management platforms such as Marin, Kenshoo or Doubleclick Search
  • Strong knowledge of digital environments and overall Internet savvy
  • High technical aptitude for learning and working within desktop and web-based applications (Windows, Microsoft Office, ad platforms); proficiency with database-driven reporting and ability to work with large data sets; strong proficiency with Microsoft Excel & other MS Office applications
  • Ability to calculate and analyze data, especially data based on standard digital advertising cost-per metrics (CPM, CPC, CPA, etc.)
  • Strong business acumen and problem-solving abilities
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; strong long-distance communication skills using email, instant messenger platforms, and phone
  • Ability to prioritize and manage frequent demands from multiple clients (internal & external)
  • Ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment and work well with cross-functional teams and varied communication styles
  • Detail-oriented with superior organizational skills and multitasking ability
  • Desire to work from home
  • B.A./B.S.

Competencies

  • Demonstrates Self Awareness
  • Optimizes Work Processes
  • Cultivates Innovation
  • Ensures Accountability
  • Planning
Apply for job

items.title: Senior Growth Marketer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
About Argent

Join us as we reimagine the future of money and the internet. Our mission is to make them more open and fair, driving new economic opportunities and putting people in control of their digital lives.

To start we've built the first crypto wallet with the simplicity and security of the best new bank apps - yet we never hold users’ assets. It takes the complexity out of Ethereum and is driven by our dedication to user experience.

We launched in 2018 and have a world-class team with experience scaling mobile apps to tens of millions of users. Our eclectic backgrounds include PhDs in nuclear physics and quantum cryptography. We’re fortunate to be backed by the top VCs in Europe, including Index Ventures, Creandum and firstminute capital.

Senior Growth Marketer

This is a pivotal role for Argent. You'll be the first person in the team dedicated to helping us achieve our ambitious growth plans. To do this you'll own all of our marketing initiatives, from idea to execution, analysis and iteration.

The strength of our product provides an outstanding foundation for you to build upon, especially for word of mouth and other organic campaigns. We've got an enthusiastic community emerging and you'll expand it further, both online and offline.

The campaigns you lead will help define our brand to a global audience. While there's a lot of room for us to grow among today's crypto users, we're particularly excited by the opportunity to bring crypto to a totally new, much wider audience.

Maximising our growth with these audiences will require creativity and rigorous analytics. Your originality, love of experimentation and adaptation will help us discover which channels are most successful and how we can best use them.

Your understanding of our customers and target market will inform our product development. This means you'll work closely with our CEO and product team.

Requirements

  • Minimum 4 years in growth or marketing at a high performance tech company or leading marketing agency
  • Experience owning every stage of the marketing funnel across multiple channels
  • Impact focused with the analytical skills and experience to assess initiatives
  • Strong storytelling and creativity
  • Happy working autonomously
  • No crypto experience necessary, but the successful candidate will be excited by the opportunity to shape the next era of the web and of open finance
  • Fluent in written and spoken English

How we work

We work remotely, transparently and balance Argent with the rest of our lives. We’ve all got loved ones with unpredictable schedules, be they kids or cats.

Although we’re a distributed team you'll need to be based in the UK or Europe. This is because we find communication much easier when we’re in similar time zones and a short flight away. Within Europe you can choose to work wherever you like!

We get together for a week every quarter so we can collaborate in person, explore new solutions, and have fun. So far we’ve been to Nice, Toulouse, Brussels, Lisbon and Barcelona.

Equal opportunities

At the heart of what we do is making crypto accessible to everyone. We want the team itself to reflect that diversity so we’d strongly encourage applications from underrepresented demographics.

items.content:
Campaign Marketing Manager

We're looking for a data-driven Campaign Marketing Manager with significant experience in the B2B SaaS software, for a long-term, 100% remote position.

Reporting into the Head of Marketing, this is a great opportunity for a hands-on, creative team-player, preferably with an enthusiasm and experience of ecommerce. 


What you’ll do:

Primary responsibilities

  • Campaign marketing: creation, organization and reporting of our outbound marketing campaigns, targeting specific prospects in North America and the UK.

  • International SEO: helping to improve our rankings around keywords in the US, increasing impressions from search and driving more organic traffic to the Veeqo marketing site.

  • Influencer outreach: building relationships with target bloggers, influencers and webmasters within the ecommerce and retail online community, driving 3rd party links from their website to Veeqo.


Secondary responsibilities

  • Email marketing: communicating to existing leads in the Veeqo database, promoting our latest content, product information and company updates

  • Social media: organization, creation and publishing of relevant content on the Veeqo social media channels

  • Optimization: Proactively identify opportunities to improve campaign performance


About you

  • Transparent - you’re open and honest, take responsibility for your actions, own up when things go wrong, and never keep your colleagues in the dark.

  • Always learning - you’re a lifetime learner, in pursuit of new information and challenges from a variety of sources to enrich your skillset and experiences.

  • Team player - you check your ego at the door every morning, and understand the importance of teamwork. We win and lose together.

  • Strive for excellence - you’re unafraid of failure, and will do whatever it takes to be the best you possibly can be in your role.


Apply for this role

If this role sounds like it could be for you, you can apply for the position here: https://forms.gle/u9117CwzbdRPjmv1A

items.content:
Product Designer at Teaching.com

Remote

(Multiple states)

Full Time

Experienced

Join the fully-remote team at Teaching.com to create, develop, and deliver fun and engaging software for educators and students!

Who We Are & What We Do

We’re working to change the future of online education by building exciting products that equip students and teachers with the tools to succeed in the classroom and beyond. Our team is hungry to learn and improve—both when it comes to our products and ourselves. We’re a small, hard-working group of self-starters who are passionate about what we do and constantly seek new ways we can be better, together.

As a team member at Teaching.com, you’ll get to strategize, design and develop the next wave of popular products from Teaching.com, like Flashcards.com and Reading.com. You’ll work alongside teammates building the world’s largest typing software, Typing.com, and Nitro Type, the #1 educational game in the world. Everyone at Teaching.com is empowered to move quickly, make decisions, and get things done so we can continue to make learning accessible to our growing community of more than 75 million students and 850k teachers internationally.

Who You Are & What You’ll Do

We are looking for a curious and passionate designer with a drive towards building web software that enables users to handle complex functions in a simple, elegant, and beautiful interface. You’re less concerned with patting yourself on the back for pixel-perfect designs and more concerned with quickly and efficiently delivering value to our users. The ideal candidate has experience leveraging data, user research and intuition to craft designs and is comfortable translating designs into HTML/CSS.

Skills & Background

  • Exceptional communication skills, particularly written (as a remote company, we heavily emphasize written communication across all departments)
  • 5+ years of designing web applications
  • A strong portfolio of product UI/UX design
  • Proficiency writing performant and accessible HTML/CSS
  • Basic understanding of browser performance and standards
  • Comfortable working in git-based workflows
  • Able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced quickly changing environment
  • A proactive approach to problem-solving with strong decision-making skills
  • A positive attitude and entrepreneurial spirit

Bonus Skills

  • Experience and/or passion for designing in the education marketplace

Compensation, Benefits & Perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Unlimited paid time off
  • Company-owned laptop
  • Remote office stipend
  • Flexible office hours
  • Ongoing education assistance
  • Annual company retreat

Position Type: Full-Time/Regular remote.

We care deeply about the culture at Teaching.com and have put together a manifesto outlining our values, communication, and product management strategies. Prospective employees will learn a great deal about what it’s like to work here by reviewing it.

Apply for job
