items.content:
Content Manager Marketing at Shield GEO

Remote | Entry-level | Part-time
  • Remote Worldwide
  • Part-Time
  • Marketing

Job Description

Are you passionate about International Business, looking for flexibility in your career and craving creative freedom? Then come join our team! We are looking for team-oriented, resourceful and self-motivated candidates.

Job Purpose: Content Manager

Shield GEO provides outsourced employment and payroll for hundreds of employees in over 60 countries. Our Marketing team is responsible for bringing leads to the sales team. We maintain, update and work on the website and create content for both existing and prospective clients. As part of the team, you’ll be involved in producing content like our A Day in the Life Series, which features stories about our employees; our annual Gender Diversity series and our collection of thought pieces by our journalist on Flexible and Remote working.

Our team collaborates closely with colleagues in Customer Success to ensure that the content delivered aligns closely with the needs of prospective clients.

This role would suit a highly creative individual. You’ll also have autonomy over your own projects and be able to clearly see the results of your work.

You will have the opportunity to work remotely and with flexible hours. You’ll also have the opportunity to advance your career in a young, growing company.

Working with Shield

If you are excited by the thought of playing an active role in a company that provides opportunities to create and innovate, you’re at the right place.

We’re a remote-friendly company with employees all around the world. We don’t want to be limited by location and are open to hiring anyone from anywhere as long as it’s a great fit for us both. Before we get to know you, you might like to get an idea of who we are so you can decide if you want to be a part of what we’re about.

Every person is unique. At Shield GEO, we encourage an inclusive culture that embraces each individual’s differences. We believe that diversity of thought and experience is vital to generating creative ideas, developing effective strategies and making better decisions.

When hiring we do not discriminate by any unlawful means including, but not limited to, race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

We offer reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities wherever possible. Our employees are provided with the basic equipment required to give them a comfortable, safe and productive workplace. If you require additional equipment beyond our standard offering we are happy to work with you to try to find a solution.

We can’t quite show you what it’s like to work with us but you can hear from our employees themselves.

  • Working remotely and flexibly with Shield Geo
  • Leave policy
  • Work equipment policy
  • Workplace Diversity policy

Do you share our values?

Our 4 values are integral to who we are. Our company culture is constantly evolving, every person who joins us adds something unique to our culture. But our values are shared by all Shield GEO employees. Do these values resonate with you?

Grow

We believe that personal growth and company growth go hand in hand. We look to foster our own growth and help grow the company. Every day is an opportunity to face a new challenge and get a little better. In our world of international employment it is impossible to know all the answers. Instead of trying to know everything, we focus on knowing how to solve problems. When mistakes happen we know it’s all part of the learning curve and we seek feedback to help us improve. We keep an eye on the big picture so we can identify improvements to processes and systems. As the problems become larger and more complex, it means that we’ll need more flexible and agile minds to come up with solutions.

Own It

We are self-motivated and love to see tasks to completion. Our managers and team mates are often in different time zones, and that’s ok! We aren’t afraid to step up when things get a little tough. We don’t like to micro-manage or be micromanaged. We trust our team mates to carry out their part of the process. We are responsible for our own workload and making sure we get our most important things done each day. If we get stuck we proactively seek help. And we show our reliability and accountability by keeping our systems updated. This also means our results can speak for themselves.

Do The Right Thing

Our clients trust us with compliance on their most important asset – their employees. This is a big responsibility! Doing the right thing means often times we choose a harder path and see it through to the end. It means we are open with our colleagues, clients and suppliers about bad news just the same as we share good news. And sometimes doing the right thing means we have to make decisions that will upset the very person we are trying to help. It’s a high standard but we stand by this very strongly. Doing the right thing also means considering how our actions impact those around us.

Be Human

We are a service business and helping people is at the core of everything we do. We pride ourselves on how we interact with colleagues, service providers and clients. We recognize that in all areas we’re dealing with real humans.

We know that working remotely and dealing with such a mix of people around the world is challenging. We know that if we are having trouble understanding someone, they are also struggling to understand us. Empathy is fundamental to helping us discover what people mean and how they are feeling. To avoid misinterpretation we assume best intent in others.
Because so much of our communication is written and asynchronous, we default to over-communication. This means we give extra details because we don’t leave people guessing. We make sure our words are clear and easy to understand. And we are kind to our fellow humans.

Your Background

  • Relevant degree OR any degree with some relevant work experience OR a few years relevant experience
  • Comfortable with technology. We are mostly remote and that means we rely on a bunch of applications to keep connected. That means video conferences and voice calls (Zoom), chat and messaging (Slack, Skype and Salesforce Chatter), shared documents (Dropbox). You’ll likely be working by yourself during parts of your day without access to tech support.
  • Experience with any of the following – WordPress, Mailchimp, Canva, Google Analytics, Salesforce, Fullstory is helpful but not essential.

Essential Characteristics of this role

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to absorb information quickly.
  • Able to prioritize effectively and work autonomously while coordinating with an international team.
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Well organised and able to manage multiple deadlines
  • Ideally located in Singapore, Hong Kong, Philippines or Australia
  • Some flexibility in working hours. We discourage overtime work and you will only be expected to work a standard number of hours each week. But we have clients and colleagues all over the world so on some rare occasions you might need to be on calls in the morning or evening.

Responsibilities

As content manager, you’ll be working on multiple web properties.

Manage Website

  • Maintain website and update pages regularly
  • Proof read and publish articles
  • Identify key pages based on website traffic and propose changes to maximise conversions
  • Manage and commission redesign of pages

Content Creation

  • Create article briefs for our writers
  • Liaise with our illustrator and journalist and manage the creation our monthly newsletters (2 per month)
  • Commissioning designs for content

Social Media

  • Manage our LinkedIn and Twitter page
  • Schedule Twitter and LinkedIn posts weekly
  • Interact and engage with key influencers in the global employment/remote spaces on Twitter

Reporting

  • Monthly Marketing Report Keyword Rankings, Analysis of Website Traffic based on findings from Google Analytics, Track Clicks and Likes on Newsletters, Social Media etc.
  • Create weekly meeting agendas for Marketing

Projects
At Shield GEO, you will have plenty of opportunities to lead and manage projects from time to time on top of your daily tasks. Every one at Shield gets involved in these projects. At the moment, you will be working on the redevelopment of one of our web properties. This project will be ongoing.

  • Managing the development of our the site you will be guided through the process but the project will be managed by you
  • Commission redesign of page and track performance
  • Monitor keyword rankings
  • Suggest ideas on how we can improve our website traffic
  • Work on getting backlinks and improving our search engine optimisation
Apply for job

items.title: Analyst II – Payroll
items.content:
Analyst II – Payroll at OneSource Virtual

Remote

Position Summary/Objective

As an Analyst II – Payroll you will be the point-of-contact for tier two resolution – working directly with our customer and internal teams to quickly resolve more complex issues and requests. You’ll also perform system testing, documentation and handle change requests. If you love technology, have strong verbal skills, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this could be the position for you.

Essential Functions/Duties/Responsibilities:

  • Coordinates, troubleshoots and manages system issues to resolution
  • Works directly with customer to analyze and document problem, recommend solution, initiate corrective actions, follow up on problem resolution and inform customer of status.
  • Responsible for adhering to the current project management methodology while influencing best practices, process improvements, and procedures
  • Interfaces with the customer to understand the customer’s overall objectives and requirements
  • Assists Consultants with project based work

Competencies:

  • Works effectively with others across multiple teams with different objectives
  • Supports multiple customers effectively
  • Expertise with particular applications and related tools to perform tasks
  • Scopes and estimates individual tasks quickly and accurately
  • Proactively reviews data and deliverables for issues and escalates
  • Clear written and oral communication skills
  • Working knowledge of customer requirements and ability to translate into technical specifications
  • Actively leveraging Workday resources to research and solve problems
  • Delivers consistent and reliable work
  • Involved in the Day to Day configuration

Supervisory Responsibility:

  • This position does not have supervisory responsibility

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience (MIS, CS, HR, Accounting..)
  • 1-3 years of technical support/functional experience/training in HCM, Payroll, or Time and Absence with with a concentration in requirements, process analysis and documentation with demonstrated customer-facing skills in the understanding and implementation of business requirements
  • Technical/Functional support of known ERP system or Technical support of other systems functionality including configuration/set-up
  • Functional experience as a Payroll Administrator or Payroll Manager
  • Experience intimeline management, issue tracking, and configuration execution
  • Experience in managing relationships and SLA’s with 3rd party ticketing system
  • Possess beginner/intermediate level Excel skills

Preferred Skills:

  • Workday experience preferred

You are encouraged to learn and share ideas when you join the OneSource Virtual team. We reward innovative thinking, fresh perspectives, creative collaboration, and hard work. As an organization experiencing routine strategic growth, we are always on the lookout for intelligent, talented, and forward-thinking professionals to join our team. OSV employees enjoy a values-based culture, upward mobility, and professional development with opportunities of all kinds.

Full time
REQ-2019-421
About Us

Founded in 2008, OneSource Virtual is a pioneer of the Business Process as a Service (BPaaS) delivery model. We are able to provide customers with a unified and comprehensive solution experience known as Consult to Operate for Workday by applying proprietary BPaaS technology to deliver Workday support, application optimization, and consulting, founded on proven industry expertise in HR outsourcing and finance.

Apply for job

items.title: Product Designer at Clevertech
items.content:
Product Designer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

user-interface
user-experience
sketchapp
product
enterprise

Job description

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

What you’ll do:

  • Create high quality design solutions from concept to production – from concept to wireframe, to mockup/prototype, to production
  • Design user flows, interaction, and pixels to turn complex data and content into simple and intuitive experiences
  • Work closely with development team to ensure technical feasibility of design
  • Confidently communicate daily with clients to understand and deliver requirements
  • Manage your own workflow to meet the deadlines which you will have set with your team to ensure success

What is Required:

  • 5 years experience developing digital products across a variety of mediums, including web and mobile
  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Product Design, or related design field (or applicable experience)
  • You understand good UX and good UI and what that means and love to create successful designs (that delights customers)
  • You have participated in the full design cycle to deliver world class, pixel perfect designs.
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong understanding of the agile software development process
  • Excited by ambiguity and rapid changes common in early-stage product development

Our Benefits
We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community



How We Work
Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work


Getting Hired
We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech Culture Video




Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

items.content:
Start your sustainable fashion career at a London-based e-commerce start up.


We are expanding our team to include two marketing interns for a three month part-time digital placement to contribute to the growth of the company.


We will expect you to help out remotely with regular online meetings. You will be independent but fully supported and we would like you to stick to deadlines.


The interns will have the chance to receive complimentary samples and, if based in London, may have the opportunity to participate in exclusive networking events (reasonable expenses will be paid).


If successful you will be considered for any future paid freelancing opportunities or a potential paid part-time role.


Note: You will be working remotely and the part-time internship period will be an unpaid one. If you are offered a job at the end, you will still have the chance to work remotely with us.


JOB DESCRIPTION


Build relationships with media organisations, key bloggers and influencers


Researching trends and social media to ensure we are ahead of the competition. We expect each intern to have a focus on one of our four pillars; sustainability – ethical /fair fashion – women’s empowerment – veganism


Creating copy for our company’s blog based on a content calendar (engaging story ideas are encouraged)


Writing press releases


Executing strategies to develop social media content to influence our target audience in a credible way (Instagram, Facebook & Pinterest but the focus is going to be on Instagram)


 


REQUIRED SKILLS


Content writing experience


Fluent English (writing & speaking)


Display a genuine passion for sustainable industry and interest in fashion


Strong communication skills


-----


We look forward to receive your CV with your published blog posts / articles! If you haven’t published any articles already, you’re welcome to share your personal blog or any content which was created by you but not published.

items.content:
Community Growth & Engagement Manager


About We Are In Beta


We - the education community - Are In Beta - always learning.


We Are In Beta is a digital learning content production company working towards a brighter education system. Supported by Teach First, The Young Foundation and Super Being Labs, we are an award-winning, teacher-led organisation. Having completed a round of funding, we now want to focus on building a team that helps us carry out our mission.



  • We believe there is a huge amount to be positive about in education, despite the negative headlines. So we give schools a voice and a platform to share it.



  • We believe the solutions to growth are within our schools already. So we unlock them and share them at scale to ensure the next generation’s potential is limitless.



  • We believe in the power of community. So we are building a community of schools, leaders and teachers who learn from each other to reimagine education.


Who are we looking for?


We’re looking for an awesome Community Engagement & Growth Manager, with an indefatigable curiosity about education and social justice. One with intelligent empathy for the people working in it and desire to serve and delight them. Someone who also believes in the power of positivity, growth and community.


You’ll work closely with the CEO/Founder to design and deliver our community engagement and growth strategy, which places practicing educators at its heart and drives educational improvement.


We’re not just looking for someone who is interested in helping us create a bold and challenging approach that’s currently missing in education, but someone who is an active voice in the room as we shape our proposition as we grow.


The questions you will be finding answers to in this role?


You’ll be asking these crucial questions, all with educational improvement and policy change as our goals:


1. Who is our community? What do they need? How do we serve them?


2. How do we build the richest people-centred CRM in education that enables us to make connections between our community and give back to them?


3. How do we grow our community to enhance the power of it for a brighter educational future?


Responsibilities in more detail:



  • Reading and truly understanding what teachers, leaders and the We Are In Beta community (listeners, followers and schools) are saying and feeling - via social media, calls, meetings and events.



  • Researching topics and powerful success stories that haven’t yet been told so we can all learn from them (using publicly available data sets/research reports, community recommendations, relationships with partners, social media, and conferences/events).



  • Serving the We Are In Beta community by giving schools a voice and championing them through our platform/channels so they can be heard and catalyse peer to peer learning.



  • Understanding, analysing and managing the community using a CRM and other digital marketing platforms.



  • Building deep and lasting relationships with schools and connecting members of the community with each other and/or with existing services that are better placed to support them.



  • Growing the We Are In Beta community by designing and implementing loyalty and membership programmes and benefits.



  • Engaging deeply, managing closely and growing quickly the community using social media - Twitter/LinkedIn/etc.



  • Mapping and building relationships with key stakeholders in the education community (schools, listeners/followers, grassroots organisations, local education authorities & opportunity areas, service providers, existing networks, multi academy trusts, teaching school alliances) to find stories, help them meet their goals, amplify their voices and secure distribution channels.



  • Working with the content production team to produce and tell stories and communicate what the community is feeling in a way that truly serves them.



  • Combining a data driven approach with a passion for multimedia content and story telling to serve the community.



  • Designing and communicating campaigns/activities/communications that serve, support and delight the WAIB community.



  • Writing regular reports/blogs/articles/newsletters/communications.



  • Setting goals and analysing and reporting performance against them.



  • Researching and developing commercial opportunities and raising funding.



  • Building, managing and maintaining relationships with partners and clients as We Are In Beta grows.


 


Who are you?


A values-driven educationalist: Shared values with We Are In Beta (see below. Knowledgeable and passionate about education, policy and social justice. An interest in and desire to make a difference and influence education policy. A background in teaching would be amazing but not essential.


Curious and empathetic: Empathy for and curiosity about schools, teachers, leaders, parents and students. Sensitive and creatively responsive to people’s needs. Passion for serving and supporting others to meet their goals.


Entrepreneurial, innovative and flexible: Thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous (but supportive) startup environment, proactive and happy to get stuck in and work flexibly within a small team. Have an innovative and entrepreneurial mindset - you’re joining a mission-driven start-up so you’ll have a chance to be part of it from the beginning of our story. Willingness to do things differently and embrace new technologies.


A relationship builder: Comfortable building and maintaining relationships - both those beginning with warm introductions and those with cold approaches. Ability to negotiate with partners, clients and funders.


An organised record keeper and project manager: Obsessed with being organised, keeping records and tracking progress. Ability to manage time, numerous tasks on multiple projects and prioritise objectives without getting flustered.


Analytical but also a content-minded story teller: Interested in trends and patterns in data and behaviour. Combined with ability to unearth powerful stories about particular topics that can inspire change beneath data. Critical reader of the press and existing content with an ability to see what’s missing or not being talked about and have ideas about how to make it more useful for teachers.


A feedback-embracing learner in pursuit of excellence: Enjoy collaborating, embrace feedback and seek others’ viewpoints. As comfortable asking for help as you are expressing your challenges to an approach being taken to ensure success. Get pleasure from going the extra mile and doing a phenomenal job. Looking for a role with room to grow that comes with the ability to shape the direction of an organisation.


 


What experience and track record do you have?


Community engagement and growth/memberships: Building an audience and keeping them engaged. Launching loyalty and membership programmes and benefits. Mapping key organisations, partners and people within a sector. Developing and maintaining partnerships.


Customer Relationship Management (CRM): Building and working with CRMs e.g. Hubspot. Updating, managing and analysing community databases using technology.


Social media: Using social media to research, communicate and build relationships - Twitter and LinkedIn. Tracking and analysing your performance, using data to iterate and improve.


Researching: Identifying topics and stories within them by. Researching using a number of different sources: print, online, academic research, national data sets, impact reports and social media.


Writing: Skilled at writing in a broad range of styles for different audiences: blogs, articles, journalism, impact reports, funding applications.


 


What will you get bonus points for?


Webinars: Planning, managing and hosting webinars. Setting topics, inviting guests, quality assuring materials and content.


Fundraising: Researching funding opportunities, developing relationships with funders and writing funding applications.


SEO: Experience with keyword research.Tagging and adding metadata to blogs and post. Analysing performance, iterating and improving.


 


The We Are In Beta Values



  • The 5 powerful story-telling Ps - positivity, personality, practicality, pioneering, plurality. We are here as the antidote to mainstream negativity about education. We are here to inspire others by showing what’s possible. To unpack how schools, teachers and leaders have succeeded. If they did it differently, and we can too, even better. We recognise no one approach is a silver bullet.



  • Growth and learning - We make content for and about people whose job it is to make learning happen. We are making it so they can learn themselves. To do this well, we must always be hungry to learn, be curious and ask questions to achieve excellence.



  • Community - The answers are within us and can be applied when they are shared by making connections. We galvanise our community around our mission by sharing our knowledge, expertise and contacts. The more we share, the stronger our community will be. We will gain strength by lifting others.



  • Diversity - We are committed to being an inclusive organisation with a diverse team. This extends to the guests we have in our stories, programmes and events, who must be reflective of our society.



  • Vulnerability - The most compelling content is made, and deepest learning happens, when people allow themselves to be vulnerable. We must strive to be vulnerable ourselves and encourage our community to do the same.



  • Service - Everything we do must serve our audience and the members of our community. If it doesn’t serve them, we don’t do it.



  • Change - until now teachers and leaders haven’t been given a platform that invites everyone to tune into. We are here to amplify their voices so they can be heard in a way that informs and improves policy.


What are the benefits?



  • Opportunity to work within an early-stage, mission-driven organisation and shape its direction and make a difference.



  • Competitive salary £25,000-£35,000 dependent on experience plus founding team EMI options for the right candidate



  • 25 days holiday



  • Exposure to the most inspirational and impactful leaders and teachers in the country



  • Flexible working culture/flexible working hours



  • Workplace pension



  • Project-based or part-time contract based on performance milestones for the right candidate


Location: London


Timeline:



  • Deadline for applications: midnight Sunday 10th November



  • First interviews: Week beginning Monday 18th November



  • Second interview: Week beginning Monday 25th November



  • Notification of decision: Week beginning Monday 2nd December



  • Start date: as soon as possible


How do you apply?


Please apply with the following no later than Sunday 10th November at midnight:


1. A covering letter (one side) outlining how your values, knowledge, skills and experience meet the requirements of the role


2. Your CV including references (maximum two sides)


3. The job title in the subject of your message.


4. In the body of your message: confirmation of where you saw the job role; confirmation of your current salary and notice period; whether you have the right to work in the UK and a valid criminal check with the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS); any links to any portfolios/bodies of work you have completed in the past to demonstrate what you are capable of (this could be reports, writing, performance figures, social media campaigns, articles, videos); and indication of whether your availability will be limited during the recruitment period.


No agencies please.


Read how We Are In Beta started here: https://weareinbeta.substack.com/subscribe


Other organisations might call this role Head of Membership, Community Engagement Manager, Director of Network Development, Network Manager, Community Experience Manager, Membership Development Manager.

Product Designer

Why join our team?


Stylindex is a fast-growing fashion tech business with offices in Los Angeles and London.

We are a growing team of talented, fun, passionate people, building a game-changing product for the fashion industry.


Role responsibilities:

  • Design and implement UI components on both mobile and desktop services
  • Research and prototype high standard UX features to improve the customer’s journey
  • Showcase and present your design solutions through wireframes, user flows and models
  • Work iteratively following Agile methodology in line with the engineering team
  • Collaborate with the product and engineering team to look into the product’s roadmap and design for the future

  • Proficiency with Sketch
  • Experience of prototype tools, particularly Invision
  • Experience working to predetermined style guides
  • Experience creating portfolios utilising both desktop and mobile solutions
  • Excellent communication skills

  • Ability to work remotely
  • Competitive salary

items.content:
Adobe Analytics Architect - Full-time - Remote, 30% travel across USA Job Description As an Analytics Architect, you will bridge the gap between business and development and develop robust analytics, optimization, and personalization solutions for our clients. You will Translate business goals into KPIs and metrics and work closely with development & QA to design systems with those metrics that are collected accurately for our clients. You will represent analytics and the importance of data to a business success. Responsibilities: Implement tagging across a variety of digital properties to ensure proper data collection Implement & maintain Adobe Analytics and Adobe Launch Integrate additional systems and building out the Martech stack Work with clients and within agile development teams to ensure feature builds are tracked in accordance with business objectives Maintain and build tagging and data structures across digital properties utilizing data-layers Support and develop processes and documentation for tagging, testing, QA and reporting Work closely with developers to ensure analytics code follows best practices Develop reports and Dashboards to meet clients needs Enable A/B testing and optimization Implement & Maintain Adobe Target Advise on testing protocols and practices to ensure testing needs are met Implement A/B tests and help prioritize testing. Support an ongoing roadmap of analytics improvements. Report on testing efforts and communicate insights to a broader audience. Support business practices Working with the development team to ensure the site is GDPR compliant. Work with marketing team to ensure end-to-end tracking of campaigns Advise and lead data integration efforts with Data Management Platforms (e.g. Adobe Audience Manager) Partner with quality assurance to ensure data has veracity. REQUIREMENTS Basic Qualifications Successful must haves In depth knowledge of Adobe Analytics, Adobe DTM/Launch (or similar tagging system) Must have passion for transforming data into meaningful insights and opportunities Experience in leading Adobe Analytics implementations across Web, mobile and apps Evangelize best-practice approaches for implementation of Adobe Analytics Must have experience with DMP (Data Management Platform) like Oracle Blue Kai or any other DMP platforms like Adobe Audience Manager. Ability to independently manage analytic projects with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail Ability to prioritize and work in a very fast-paced environment Ability to work collaboratively with cross functional teams like product owners, technologies teams and marketing partners Excellent written and oral communication skills Development skills: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, jQuery, Data layers Problem solving skills: using tools such as Charles, WASP or developers console to diagnose and solve issues. Strong critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills. Nice to have Data visualization experience: workspace, report builder, PowerBI, and tableau Experience with agile methodologies: Scrum Mobile tagging experience Soft Skills Ability to collaborate/negotiate with various technology and business stakeholders Verbal and written skills to be able to communicate effectively to both a technical and business audience Expertise and patience to be able to explain analytics to various groups with differing levels of analytics knowledge and exposure Organizational and time management skills to prioritize work in a demanding environment Drive and curiosity to understand the relationships between data and activities, draw conclusions and use critical thinking to validate/verify outputs For any additional information please feel free to reach me at Email: TA Digital (Formerly TechAspect) is an equal opportunity employer. ABOUT TA Digital (Formerly TECHASPECT) TechAspect is an innovative digital transformation agency, specializing in delivering digital experience, commerce, and marketing solutions. For nearly two decades, we have been helping traditional businesses transform and create dynamic digital cultures through disruptive strategies and agile deployment of innovative solutions. We are known as a global leader in the digital technology industry for helping marketing leaders achieve their revenue targets, create profitable, omni-channel customer and commerce experiences. TechAspect has high-level strategic partnerships with digital technology companies Adobe, Microsoft, Sitecore, Acquia, Marketo, SAP Hybris, Elastic Path, BigCommerce, IBM Watson Marketing, and Episerver. The company was named on 2013, 2014, 2015 Inc. 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing technology companies in the United States. - provided by Dice

items.title: Associate Monitoring
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Clearance Level Must Currently Possess:

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain:

Suitability:

Job Family:

Cyber Security

Job Description:

Job Description

The Associate Monitoring Analyst responsibilities include:

  • Support monitoring of all Information Assurance Devices (IADs) to identify and document all intrusions and attempted intrusions.
  • Document of evidence of system security compromise, generate of trend reports, and collect evidence of malicious or anomalous activity.
  • Report security incidents and/or network intrusions to Incident Handlers for dissemination to appropriate DOT points of contacts.
  • Identify anomalous and malicious activity.
  • Contribute to content creation, prioritize, rank and escalated incidents.
  • Provide support in the detection, response, mitigation, and reporting of cyber threats affecting client networks.
  • Maintain an understanding of the current vulnerabilities, response, and mitigation strategies used in cyber security operations.
  • Assist in producing status reports and briefs to senior leadership; provide analysis for correlated information sources.
  • Analyze and report cyber threats as well as assist in deterring, identifying, monitoring, investigating and analyzing computer network intrusions.
  • Associate Monitoring Analysts must provide recommendations based on best practice and experience to develop processes that will enhance efficiencies needed to perform the above.


Job Qualifications:

Required Education and Experience:
Education:
- Bachelor's degree
- OR
- Minimum six (6) years of relevant professional experience.

Experience:
- In addition to required education or equivalent experience;
- Minimum six (6) years IT experience

- Experience with IDS/IPS (Sourcefire/Firepower or Snort preferred)

- Experience with SIEM tools (ArcSight preferred)

AND
- Must have three (3) years experience network security analysis, using intrusion detection systems.
- Must have experience conducting analysis at the packet level.

Preferred Experience:
- Experience with netflow data and analysis (Netwitness Packets preferred)

- Experience with packet analysis
- CISSP and/or SANS/GIAC Certification (equivalent to two year experience

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

40

Telecommuting Options:

Work Location:

USA VA Leesburg

Additional Work Locations:

For more than 50 years, General Dynamics Information Technology has served as a trusted provider of information technology, systems engineering, training, and professional services to customers across federal, state, and local governments, and in the commercial sector. Over 40,000 GDIT professionals deliver enterprise solutions, manage mission-critical IT programs, and provide mission support services worldwide. GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

items.title: bant.io: Digital Marketing Manager (100% Remote)
items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager (100% Remote)

We're looking for a data-driven Marketing Manager with significant experience in the B2B SaaS software space, for a long-term, 100% remote position.

We offer a fixed salary + commission on performance.

  
Responsibilities

  • Implement existing B2B marketing strategies while identifying potential areas of improvement
  • Develop/promote new channels and drive traffic to the website to generate more leads
  • Develop strategic partnerships to help increase the number of leads
  • Develop and optimize paid acquisition campaigns on platforms such as (but not limited to) Facebook, Google Ads, Bing, Youtube, Twitter
  • Organize the creation and publishing of relevant content on our social media accounts
  • Organize the creation of live but also automated webinars to generate more leads
  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve campaign performance
  • Design and analyze performance reports and dashboards to measure and optimize marketing ROI
  • Ad hoc B2B marketing support





 Requirements

  • Minimum experience of 5 years in the B2B SaaS software space (experience in the lead generation industry a plus!)
  • We want someone who understands marketing analytics and has data-driven thinking
  • Familiar and comfortable with split testing techniques
  • Expert in funnel management and conversion optimization through to the sale
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

items.title: Retail & Channel Marketing Manager
items.content:
Retail & Channel Marketing Manager

United Kingdom, Berkshire
Company: BMS Performance Ltd

Overview

  • New role from a leading consumer technology business
  • Remit to build out the EMEA channel marketing function
  • Partner with major technology retailers
  • Design, implement and execute a Channel Marketing strategy

The Role: An exciting Retail & Channel Marketing Manager position has arisen within a fast-growing consumer technology start-up business who are looking for someone to design, implement and execute the Channel Marketing vision and strategy.

The purpose of the Retail & Channel Marketing Manager is to help drive consumer demand through marketing engagement with channel, trade and retail partners. you will be responsible for managing the trade and channel marketing across EMEA. You will create, develop and execute joint campaigns with customers within the distribution, retail and indirect sales channels.

Responsibilities for the position of Retail & Channel Marketing Manager include:

  • Overall responsibility for creating the marketing strategy for a key distribution and retailer accounts
  • Developing relationships with key people in key accounts and 3rd party partners
  • Measuring ROI and adapting strategy accordingly
  • Managing and briefing agencies
  • Anticipating internal and external business issues and developments and utilising this knowledge for target setting, prioritisation and driving improvements.
  • Driving the strategy and execution of the Field Engagement Team – including field team management; training and evangelism; compliance and audit checking
  • Engaging and developing Amazon A+ content in conjunction with the EMEA Digital lead
  • Designing, developing and creating marketing assets to support activities in Channel
  • Driving the strategy of retail execution and joint customer campaigns alongside the sales and marketing teams
  • Delivering and managing the bespoke retail POS engagement activity


Requirements for the position of Retail & Channel Marketing Manager are:

  • At least 5 years’ experience from either a sales or channel marketing role in technology or FMCG, or senior marketing operational experience from a relevant sector
  • Resourceful self-starter with experience in trade channel marketing and or field/retail marketing
  • in the development of strategy and translation into field sales activities
  • Experience of co-ordinating activities in business driven from multi communication channels
  • Good people skills with a proven ability to network and form good business relationships
  • Education to degree level or equivalent is desirable but not essential
  • Knowledge of digital CRM and engagement platforms also desirable but not essential

The Company: Our client has recently been spun out from a technology company, supported with great internal talent and major financial backing. They offer innovative products that have been very well received in the market. This role is focused on the EMEA region and will focus on support key markets including the UK, France, Germany and the Netherlands. The company are going through an exciting period of growth and this role will suit a person who is up for a challenge and is looking for an opportunity to put their stamp on a division and region.

The Package for Retail & Channel Marketing Manager, EMEA

  • Salary – day rate of £150-£250 (circa £48k-£60k per annum) paid either via your own company or via BMS Performance Ltd.

Location: The position of Retail & Channel Marketing Manager, EMEA is based in Bracknell and can be home-based a number of days a week.

BMS Performance have spent years building strong relationships with leading companies. We can introduce you to the right companies for your skillset and provide guidance to help you get your next Marketing role.

If you have recently met with a BMS Consultant at our Egham office please contact them directly to discuss this opportunity.

Apply for job

items.title: Teaching.com: Product Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=11}
items.content:
Product Designer

Join the fully-remote team at Teaching.com to create, develop, and deliver fun and engaging software for educators and students!

Who We Are & What We Do
We’re working to change the future of online education by building exciting products that equip students and teachers with the tools to succeed in the classroom and beyond. Our team is hungry to learn and improve—both when it comes to our products and ourselves. We’re a small, hard-working group of self-starters who are passionate about what we do and constantly seek new ways we can be better, together. 

As a team member at Teaching.com, you’ll get to strategize, design and develop the next wave of popular products from Teaching.com, like Flashcards.com and Reading.com. You’ll work alongside teammates building the world’s largest typing software, Typing.com, and Nitro Type, the #1 educational game in the world. Everyone at Teaching.com is empowered to move quickly, make decisions, and get things done so we can continue to make learning accessible to our growing community of more than 75 million students and 850k teachers internationally.

Who You Are & What You’ll Do
We are looking for a curious and passionate designer with a drive towards building web software that enables users to handle complex functions in a simple, elegant, and beautiful interface. You’re less concerned with patting yourself on the back for pixel-perfect designs and more concerned with quickly and efficiently delivering value to our users. The ideal candidate has experience leveraging data, user research and intuition to craft designs and is comfortable translating designs into HTML/CSS. 

Skills & Background 
  • Exceptional communication skills, particularly written (as a remote company, we heavily emphasize written communication across all departments)
  • 5+ years of designing web applications
  • A strong portfolio of product UI/UX design
  • Proficiency writing performant and accessible HTML/CSS
  • Basic understanding of browser performance and standards
  • Comfortable working in git-based workflows
  • Able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced quickly changing environment
  • A proactive approach to problem-solving with strong decision-making skills
  • A positive attitude and entrepreneurial spirit

Bonus Skills
  • Experience and/or passion for designing in the education marketplace

Compensation, Benefits & Perks
  • Competitive salary
  • Unlimited paid time off
  • Company-owned laptop
  • Remote office stipend
  • Flexible office hours
  • Ongoing education assistance
  • Annual company retreat

How to Apply
Apply online via JazzHR

Position Type
Full-Time/Regular remote.

NO RECRUITERS.
Sorry, we will not transfer or sponsor visas. 
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

items.title: Growth Designer
items.content:
Growth Designer at Shogun

Remote | International

$75k – $90k • 0.0% – 0.05%

We are: Shogun, a powerful page builder platform for eCommerce stores. We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we’re backed by Initialized Capital, and we have over 10,000 active paying clients. We are looking for: A Growth Designer to join our growing design team and help drive the design of our marketing efforts and public image

You will:

  • Have ownership over our .com, marketing communications, careers efforts, and growth experiments
  • Influence the overall brand and aesthetic of the company
  • Work hand in hand with the growth team to ship experimental products that grow our user-base

You must:

  • Be able to come up with creative solutions to problems
  • Have great graphic design and visual UI design skills (Illustration is also a huge bonus!)
  • Have sharp, pixel-perfect visual skills and experience in the latest design software
  • Have a super high standard of quality

We offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Competitive equity
  • Benefits (Health and PTO)
  • A highly skilled and dedicated team that is fun to work with
  • Remote work – We are a fully distributed team that works from anywhere with good internet

PLEASE NOTE:

  • Our team is fully distributed and global (check out our team page). We have no office. You should be comfortable with remote work.
  • Sometimes we hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location.

Location: Remote

Job type: Full-time

Visa sponsorship: Not available

Experience: 3+ years

Skills: Web Design, Graphic Design,Visual Design, UI/UX Design

items.title: Gower Street Analytics: Senior Developer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=11, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=24, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Senior Developer

Description

Gower Street Analytics is a well-funded growing startup doing predictive analytics and data science in the movie business. We have contracts with major movie studios that are household names. We believe in improving transparency and collaboration within the film industry, and helping companies make data-driven booking and logistical decisions. We're growing the development team, so we're looking for one senior developer with at least 5 years experience to join our team.

We code in a range of languages, including Clojure, ClojureScript, Python, R, Bash and JavaScript. We use Postgres and S3 for persistence, and host a range of web services and APIs with Docker, Terraform and AWS.

We are a remote-first organisation, and the Development, Data Science and Product teams work all over the UK. We also have an office in Central London that you are welcome to work from whenever you wish to.

Here’s what you might expect on joining the tech team:

Within your first month
  • You shipped several things, pairing with other developers via tmux and video chat for much of your day.
  • You had lots of questions - we had lots of answers.
  • You are learning at least one piece of technology you are unfamiliar with, drawing our on strong tech culture of curiosity.
  • You've learnt how to work closely with other remote people on your team, adopting our strong remote-first culture. This is regardless of whether you're working in the London office regularly, you've visited once, or you haven't been at all.
  • You understood how Gower Street will significantly impact the future of the movie industry. You know our short term business goals, why they’re important and how we’re tackling them.

Within your first three months
  • You have continued pairing with others on all areas of the code, leading independently on areas you’re most familiar with.
  • You have an overview of the tech stack, naturally specialising in one or more areas.
  • You have been a part of one of our six week development cycles. You've seen how our process works from pitching ideas, negotiating scope and working in very small teams to completion.
  • You have worked with our film analyst team to improve their workflow, helping the company to estimate the movie box office worldwide.
  • You'll have been coached weekly in Data Science, Software Development or Product Development (your choice)
  • By now you most likely will have been at a whole company meetup in London, working remotely the rest of the time.
  • You will likely have caused a bug that was fixed by a team member without any blame, and may have done the same for someone else. You will have improved our systems to minimise the impact of human error in future.

Within your first year
  • You have taught someone else what you have learned so far.
  • You shipped significant features that bring lasting value to our customers.
  • You attended two technical conferences to grow and learn, and perhaps as a speaker and ambassador for Gower Street.

Requirements
  • You are smart, get things done and love to ship features to customers.
  • You are keen to learn and try new languages, tools and technologies.
  • You are familiar with functional programming. You will be comfortable in at least one programming language, perhaps more.
  • You are comfortable self-managing and working remotely over video chat for much of the day.
  • You are eligible to work in the UK, and are able to get to London once every few months.

Benefits
  • You will earn over market salaries for on-site roles, even though we’re fully remote. We also contribute 3% of your salary to a pension.
  • You will get five weeks off a year, plus eight bank holidays, and private health insurance.
  • You will know exactly how your salary is calculated through our transparent compensation ladder, and what you need to do to progress.
  • As long as you’re available during our office hours, you can live and work anywhere you like in the UK.
  • You will choose your own working environment - you aren’t forced to work in a noisy open plan office.
  • If you require more flexibility - we are open to discussing different working patterns like a 4-day week to help you maintain a good balance
  • You’ll get the chance to go to one “big” and one “small” technical conference each year.
  • You will get what you need to work to start with us, including a large monitor, laptop, docking station and a decent office chair. We’ll also get you anything else you need as things move on.
  • You’ll get Wednesday afternoons to work on self-directed projects, individually or in groups, with the aim of personal improvement and innovation of new products.

items.title: Curriculum Product Manager (First Aid)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(germani, unitedkingdom, austria, croatia, hrvatska, denmark, franc, ireland, netherland, spain, sweden, switzerland)
items.content:
Curriculum Product Manager (First Aid)

United Kingdom, Manchester
Company: BRITISH RED CROSS-11

Overview

Curriculum Product Manager (First Aid)
Location: Flexible within the UK (with regular meetings in our London Office)
Contract type: Fixed-term contract until 25th of September 2020
Hours per week: 35
Salary: Up to £28,000 per annum depending on experience

Are you a Product Manager with a track record of developing and delivering multi-phase projects? Do you have experience working with children and young people and developing online resources for them?

What you will be doing
The Curriculum Product Manager will support the evaluation, development and roll-out of first aid education resources through our interactive digital platform for the new RSE and health curriculum for English schools as well as continue to support the other national curricula. This will be a multi-phase, multi-product digital response to this opportunity.

You will manage the evaluation of an online suite of education resources designed to deliver real impact: to help children and young people to learn the basic concepts of first aid, to build confidence in their skills and ability to help others and to explore concepts of kindness and humanitarianism.

You will use the evaluation results to identify and manage further development opportunities on the platform. Development work may include: activity toolkits, example lesson plans, videos, images, interactive learner resources, delivery resources and community support.

Meet the team
The First Aid Curriculum Product Manager will sit within the Education division of the UK Operations directorate.

The Red Cross has been supporting children, young people and their educators with first aid resources for over 10 years. Our quality assured suites of online resources have a reputation for empowering educators to deliver first aid teaching making a real difference to children and young people’s willingness, confidence and knowledge to help others when they need it the most. The statutory inclusion of first aid on the English curriculum is a significant step forward in recognising the value of everyone, regardless of age, learning first aid and the difference it can make to people’s lives.

Our humanitarian education, underpinned by the fundamental principles of the Red Cross Red Crescent Movement, equips children, young people and adults with the knowledge and skills to make sense of the world around them and to act in the right way at the right time.

What we are looking for
As our ideal candidate, you must have substantial experience of successfully implementing and managing large complex projects delivering significant change, including projects with a technology and digital dimension.

You will have previous experience working with children or young people and a good understanding of the national educational curricula. You will have a proven track record of developing online learning resources for children and young people.

You will have excellent communication and team-building skills enabling you to establish effective working relationships with different stakeholders across the organisation.

We are particularly keen to hear from candidates with an educational digital resource development background. Experience with video and image production, content management systems and analytics tracking and reporting would be an advantage.

Closing date for applications is 23:59 on the 3rd of November 2019 with interviews provisionally scheduled for 11th and 12th November.

We offer a wide range of staff benefits, these include:

  • 36 days holiday (including Bank Holidays)
  • Option to buy an extra 5 days annual leave
  • Up to 6% contributory pension
  • Flexible working policy

A little bit more about us…
The British Red Cross help anyone, anywhere in the UK; get the support they need if crisis strikes. From hiring a wheelchair or dealing with loneliness, to adjusting to life in a new country – we’re there when you need us.

Our organisation was born out of a desire to bring help without discrimination. Impartiality and neutrality have been central values for the Red Cross since we started.

At the British Red Cross, we are looking for the best people to help us provide support to millions of people affected by crisis in the UK. We want our team to reflect the diversity of the communities we serve, offering equal opportunities to everyone, regardless of; age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Diversity is something we celebrate and we want you to be able to bring your authentic-self to the Red Cross. We want you to feel that you are in an inclusive environment, and a great position to help us spread the power of kindness.

In the British Red Cross we will not tolerate any form of misconduct, including sexual harassment, exploitation and abuse. We have a code of conduct in place, and are committed to creating a culture of integrity in the organisation where misconduct is not tolerated, situations of abuse are quickly investigated and perpetrators are dealt with effectively.

If you are appointed to a role within BRC you will be subject to the organisation’s Code of Conduct, a copy of which you can find on our website.

The British Red Cross, incorporated by Royal Charter 1908, is a charity registered in England and Wales (220949) and Scotland (SC037738).

Follow us on and on Linked in – British Red Cross, to hear about our latest job vacancies.

Connecting human kindness with human crisis

Apply for job

items.title: Community Manager
items.content:
School Space - Why


Like it or not, funding plays a critical role in a schools ability to deliver a great education, and we are unfortunately facing a funding cut crisis in the UK, the scale of which hasn’t been seen since WWII. This is the first problem we’re trying to solve. 


Secondly, a recent study (conducted by the Eden project) identified that disconnected communities cost the UK economy over £32 billion/year. Extensive research has concluded that people feel happier, safer and more content when they live in connected communities and know their neighbours. 


This is where School Space comes in. 


School Space - How


Schools have lots of spaces that sit empty on evenings, weekends, and holidays. We work with schools across the South East to help them let their spaces to community groups, which not only increases school income, it also makes affordable spaces available to the locals which in turn helps to build a thriving school at the center of a thriving community.


School Space - Team


Founders James and Jemma have been working on this problem for 8 years, and recent success includes investment raises, 45 partner schools, and over a million generated for them. We’ve been on the Techstars 2018 Cohort, been nominated for Social Enterprise UK’s Social Enterprise of the Year,  and picked up a few awards and amazing networks along the way. Our team are committed to the nth degree and full of the belief that social business is the model of the future. We have endless determination to see School Space grow fast and well, scaling our impact across the UK and beyond.


The Role - Why


Our operation covers 45 schools (and growing), 90+ incredible part-time Community Connectors (the amazing people who open and close our schools) and thousands of events annually. 


The Community Manager is responsible for leading, training and inspiring a group of our Community Connectors. You will have administrative support, but will lead the direction and engagement strategy to ensure our team are empowered with the tools to do their job.


The Role - How


Key responsibilities include:



  • Line Management - whilst most of our remote team work between 5-15 hours per week, they need a point of contact, and you must master supporting them individually whilst drawing on others in your team to balance this responsibility.

  • Developing and Leading an engagement strategy - our Community Connectors (CCs) already engage via weekly videos from the co-founders and use slack to communicate, but we want you to revamp their ‘journey’ as a School Space team member, developing the touchpoints they should have to feel supported throughout their lifetime with us.

  • Developing a training programme - you would be responsible for starting the ‘School Space Academy’, which will involve training new starters and providing refreshers for existing staff members.


What we want from you:



  • Experience in leading communities, or managing large groups of people to success.

  • A track record of developing a strategy yourself and seeing it through.

  • Empathy and excellent people skills - an ability to manage but also inspire via ‘low touch’ methods including innovative techniques.

  • The ability to self-start and self manage, to bring your own ideas to the table and manage them from start to finish.

  • Excellent time management and prioritisation skills.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, comfortable with using basic tech tools such as slack.

  • The ability and desire to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment with peers who challenge you to constantly improve.

  • An eagerness to take on more responsibility, and you thrive on change - we are a start up and that means things are fast moving.

  • Comfort in working evenings and weekends, as training will have to be done in these hours (expectation; minimum one weekend a month, taken in lieu)

items.title: Digital Health Coach (Remote - New York) - Omada
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Note: Please only apply to one of our "(Remote - New York)" positions to be considered. The start date for this role will be in the first week of January 2020.

Omada Health is on a mission to inspire and engage people in lifelong health, one step at a time.

We're hiring digital health coaches for a work-from-home position. We are looking for individuals with previous health coaching, life coaching, or weight loss coaching experience, but most importantly, we're looking for all-around tech-savvy, intelligent, empathetic, and efficient people who have a commitment to helping Omada define and advance digital health coaching.

Your role is to guide participants through Omada's 16-week online program to help them avoid progression to obesity-related chronic diseases. You will be fully supported by our online platform, which includes a detailed curriculum and technology to help track participants' progress. You will leverage this cutting-edge platform to strategically coach participants through our program, using data science to inform outreach methods during moments that matter. Your primary responsibilities will include private messaging participants through our platform and facilitating conversation on a group board. Additionally, you will actively collaborate with our Clinical, Data, Product and Operations teams to discover and drive digital health coaching best practices.

The work will be done remotely from your home using an Omada-provided computer. You will be required to attend several remote meetings per week which are held during business hours (9 AM - 5 PM); additionally, some travel will be required for quarterly in-person team meetings.

You will love this job if you have/are:

The ability the translate face-to-face interactions to the digital world A compassionate and empathetic "people person" A strong commitment to participant privacy Excited to be at the intersection of healthcare and technology Proven technical ability and a high level of tech savviness A firm grasp on effective and efficient communication through digital platforms A fast learner and are able to adapt to a constantly changing environment Committed to Omada's mission and the lifestyle changes we inspire Minimum education: Bachelor's degree

Key Requirements:

Must possess an active Certified Dietitian, Certified Nutritionist, or Certified Dietitian-Nutritionist license through the New York State Education Department Available during business hours (9 AM - 5 PM) Monday - Friday

Bonus:

Successful digital health coaching experience Possess an active Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP) Lifestyle Coach certification Possess an active Certified Diabetes Educator (CDE) certification through the National Certification Board for Diabetes Educators (NCBDE)

Benefits:

Competitive salary Flexible vacation plan Parental leave Health, dental, and vision Allowance for home office setup Stipend for professional development Two giftable Omada enrollments per calendar year

About Omada Health: We've pioneered digital behavioral medicine: an innovative approach to tackling the growing epidemic of type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and obesity. Our online programs combine world-class science, technology, and design to inspire and enable people everywhere to live free of chronic disease. Named one of Fast Company's "50 Most Innovative Companies in the World," our team includes passionate and talented individuals. Our approach has been embraced by major employers across the country, including Costco and Iron Mountain, as well as leading health plans, such as Kaiser Permanente and BlueCross Blue Shield of Louisiana.

We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.
