We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to lead our inbound and outbound marketing activities. You’ll be responsible for presenting our products in ways that will strengthen our brand and boost sales. You should be familiar with various product marketing techniques, like email campaigns and content marketing. Your goal will be to develop and implement the most profitable plans to position and promote our products.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement direct email marketing campaigns

  • Develop a content strategy aligned with short-term and long-term marketing targets

  • Follow and analyze market trends to position products

  • Craft compelling messages across marketing channels (landing pages, ad campaigns)

  • Evaluate projects using relevant KPIs and feedback from existing and prospective customers





Requirements




  • Proven experience as a Marketing Manager, ideally in a SaaS business

  • Excellent communication and copywriting skills in English

  • Working knowledge of web analytics tools (Google Analytics, Heap Analytics, Mixpanel)

  • Analytical mind and strong quantitative skills

  • Familiar with product marketing tactics (e.g. integrated marketing campaigns)





Benefits




  • Meaningful early employee Share Options

  • Hip office in WeWork with plenty of comfy hangout spaces and community events

  • Free refreshments (coffee, tea, beer, cider, cookies, etc.)

  • A top-notch Macbook set up with a monitor and accessories

  • Flexible hours and an option to work remotely

  • A learning budget for books, courses, and conferences

  • Regular team off-sites

  • 30-day annual holiday allowance


No agencies and recruiters, please.

items.title: Villa Reservation Agent
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 2W hour
items.content:
Villa Reservation Agent at World Travel Holdings

Remote

Job Location: US-Remote

Category: Sales

Type: Regular Full-Time

Overview

Are you passionate about sales? Do you possess luxury travel experience? Would you like to work from home? If yes, this may be the role for you!

World Travel Holdings is seeking a Villa Specialist to work in our Luxury Division. In this role, you will maximize revenue by successfully building client relationships, closing sales, and maintaining client relationships that generate repeat business and referrals. Completing paperwork, administrative functions and other non-phone work related to the effective processing of customer Villa rentals to provide a remarkable client experience.

Responsibilities

  • Handle all company supplied villa leads in a polite and courteous manner, and in accordance with WTH sales guidelines. Convey enthusiasm to customers with a genuine desire to be of service.
  • Effectively identify the full extent of the customer’s requirements to optimize sales of villa products and services. Use your product and destination expertise to make full-experience recommendations to the customer.
  • Work with villa suppliers to confirm availability, process and release holds, and invoice the customer once a purchasing decision has been made.
  • Inform customers of the appropriate terms and conditions along with any other relevant information relating to their villa reservation. Highly recommend the purchase of trip protection throughout the quoting and booking process.
  • Input reservations using the company reservation and invoicing system. Ensure comprehensive and accurate collection of all appropriate customer information, and send invoice, contract and accompanying documents to customer in a timely manner.
  • Complete paperwork, administrative functions and other non-phone work related to the effective processing of customer villa rentals.
  • Execute Villa’s “Guest First” philosophy in all interactions.
  • Build rapport and long-term relationships with customers.
  • Maintain periodic contact with existing and prospective customers through outbound efforts to generate new business and build a repeat client base.
  • Ensure performance goals are achieved consistently and in accordance with WTH luxury brands quality standards.
  • Initially deal with customer inquiries and complaints involving the Supervisor or Customer Service when appropriate.
  • Work with peers within the villa division Buddy System framework.
  • Report to assigned team meetings and/or training sessions.
  • Enhance product knowledge by completing online, on-demand courses as required.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 2+ years selling luxury travel; experience with villa travel preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to interact successfully with affluent clientele
  • Strong destination-based knowledge of popular luxury vacation destinations such as France, Italy, Mexico, Europe, Hawaii and the Caribbean
  • Highly motivated to sell; ability to build strong customer relationships and offer exceptional service
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills to include personable, professional telephone etiquette
  • Self-disciplined and accountable for achievement of goals, continuous learning and self-improvement
  • Demonstrated proficiency with the internet and Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Outlook
  • As a work at home agent, you must be able to provide a designated space for a home office free of distractions, high speed internet connection (minimum Internet speeds of 2.0 Mbps upload and 5 Mbps download) and a separate phone land line (not over the internet) dedicated to this position. Please note this home office must not be in the same residence as another current World Travel Holdings’ at home employee.
  • Must be able to work a flexible, full-time schedule (40 hours per week). Core hours for villa sales are Mon-Fri, 8a-8p EST and Sat/Sun, 9a-6p EST (hours subject to change).
  • Must be a resident and live in a US state. We do not currently hire in AK, CA, HI, KY, ND, OH, OR, and PA.

About World Travel Holdings
World Travel Holdings is the world’s largest cruise agency and award-winning leisure travel company with a portfolio of more than 40 diverse brands. In addition to owning some of the largest brands distributing cruises, villas, hotels, resort vacations, cars and luxury travel services, World Travel Holdings has a vast portfolio of licensed private label partnerships comprised of top leisure travel providers, including almost every U.S. airline, leading hotel brands and prominent corporations. The company also operates a top-rated travel agency franchise and the country’s original host agency, and is consistently recognized as an industry leader in work-at-home employment. Its global presence includes operating multiple cruise and vacation brands in the United Kingdom. World Travel Holdings has offices in Wilmington, Mass.; Ft. Lauderdale, Fla.; Virginia Beach, Va.; New York, NY; and Chorley, England.

Apply for job

items.title: Copy Chief
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Copy Chief at Medium Corporation

Remote

SAN FRANCISCO, NY OR REMOTE W/IN U.S.

EDITORIAL

Medium’s mission is to help people deepen their understanding of the world and discover ideas that matter. We are building a place where ideas are judged on the value they provide to readers, not the fleeting attention they can attract for advertisers. We are creating the best place for reading and writing on the internet—a place where today’s smartest writers, thinkers, experts, and storytellers can share big, interesting ideas.

We’re looking for a Copy Chief to oversee the flow of articles from our growing roster of publications through the copy edit process. In addition to copy editing some of our stories, the copy chief will supervise the copy desk, a team of remote copy editors across the country who read and check every article before publication. The copy chief will also own and update the Medium style guide as our editorial strategy evolves. Are you passionate about language? Do you believe that using the right words at the right time matters? Are you obsessed with pristine copy? Come join our team.

What will you do?

  • You will triage workload by distributing articles to copy editors, including daily stories and longer-term projects.
  • You will evaluate the distribution of copy editing resources, making decisions about which stories need more time and care and which need less.
  • You will work with story editors and editorial operations to ensure that all articles are moving through the copy desk in a timely manner.
  • You will hire, manage, and provide feedback to our remote team of copy editors.
  • You will own, maintain, and improve Medium’s style guide.

You have:

  • At least 10 years of experience as an editor or copy editor in print or digital journalism.
  • Experience editing breaking news, features, and interactive projects, as well as social media and web production.
  • A meticulous eye for detail and a commitment to producing the highest-quality journalism possible.
  • A sophisticated relationship with copy, in that you are a stickler on details but can appreciate stylistic deviations from the rules.
  • World-class organizational skills.
  • Confidence working in a fast-paced, bicoastal start-up environment.
  • Experience managing and evaluating staff members for performance.
  • Familiarity with Medium and its unique opportunities for expression and interaction.
  • Expertise with AP Style.

At Medium, we foster an inclusive, supportive, fun yet challenging team environment. We value having a team that is made up of a diverse set of backgrounds and respect the healthy expression of diverse opinions. We embrace experimentation and the examination of all kinds of ideas through reasoning and testing. Come join us as we continue to change the world of digital media. Medium is an equal opportunity employer.

Interested? We’d love to hear from you.

Apply for job

items.title: Product Designer at Clevertech
items.content:
Product Designer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

user-interface
user-experience
sketchapp
product
enterprise

Job description

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

What you’ll do:

  • Create high quality design solutions from concept to production – from concept to wireframe, to mockup/prototype, to production
  • Design user flows, interaction, and pixels to turn complex data and content into simple and intuitive experiences
  • Work closely with development team to ensure technical feasibility of design
  • Confidently communicate daily with clients to understand and deliver requirements
  • Manage your own workflow to meet the deadlines which you will have set with your team to ensure success

What is Required:

  • 5 years experience developing digital products across a variety of mediums, including web and mobile
  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Product Design, or related design field (or applicable experience)
  • You understand good UX and good UI and what that means and love to create successful designs (that delights customers)
  • You have participated in the full design cycle to deliver world class, pixel perfect designs.
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong understanding of the agile software development process
  • Excited by ambiguity and rapid changes common in early-stage product development

Our Benefits
We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community



How We Work
Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work


Getting Hired
We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech Culture Video




Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

items.content:
We’re looking for experienced, engaging and highly-effective inclusion and mentoring trainers to co-design and deliver our innovative and impactful coaching and inclusion programmes in organisations across the creative industries.


About Creative Mentor Network


Creative Mentor Network is a charity with a mission to make the creative world of work more diverse and inclusive through mentoring. We work with colleges across London to connect talented 16-25 year olds from diverse backgrounds with those working in the creative industries. 


We work with some great partners across the creative industries - Havas, Soho House, Sony Music and Sky - matching up their employees with young people and supporting their journey into the industry.


Our model is designed so that everyone wins: supportive careers guidance for students; training and development for mentors; access to diverse talent for creative businesses.


We’re small, but growing fast. We work closely together and always for the benefit of the young people we support. This is a great opportunity to work with a growing charity at an exciting time.


 


About the role


Our Associate Trainers are responsible for engagingly, impactfully and professionally delivering discursive and theory based organisational training.


This delivery could be a one-off 2 hour workshop, half a day, or could be part of a course of training spanning 16 weeks.


Our training workshops are designed, drawing from unique and bespoke Creative Mentor Network content. However, it’s important to us to constantly evolve and improve our offer. As an Associate Trainer, you will also be involved in Creative Mentor Network development days where we bring together our expertise to innovate and develop our training.


Organisational facilitators are also responsible for certain preparatory and logistical tasks relating to the successful running of a workshop or programme. This will include preparing and transporting resources required and developing the training content to ensure it is relevant and meets the needs of each client.


Salary: Rates of pay differ depending on: level of experience, the structure and length of the programme, and the client. Therefore, facilitators can expect to be paid between £200 – £400 per day.


Location: Variable, in London


Contract: Freelance


Start date: December 2019 / January 2020
Deadline to apply: Friday 1st November


Training Dates: You must be available to attend a training session on either Thursday 31st October 5-7pm, Tuesday 5th November 2.30-4.30pm, Tuesday 26th November 2.30-4.30pm


Interviews: We will organise interviews on a rolling basis, part of the interview process will be delivering a workshop.


Experience we are looking for



  • Experience of successfully delivering engaging organisational training

  • Experience in any of the following areas: coaching, leadership development, education, equality, inclusion and diversity


Skills and knowledge



  • Strong reliability and professionalism

  • The ability to create safe and courageous learning spaces

  • Familiarity with the concepts of social and cultural capital, and the debates surrounding diversity, inclusion and social mobility.

  • Understanding of models of coaching, and leadership styles

  • The ability to support the thinking of adults in an engaging way

  • Flexibility in facilitation and courage to face problems when they arise in a workshop

  • Open to feedback and developing your capacities and skills

  • Creativity in the face of challenges and unexpected logistical issues

  • Strong communication skills

  • Organised and prepared, with good time-awareness and can-do, positive attitude to making our mentor training have the most impact possible


To apply


Email a CV and a short cover statement of no more than 200 words to Isabel.

items.content:
Titan School Solutions

Software Business Analyst

Titan School Solutions is an EdTech startup that is on the fast track for growth and is changing the face of school nutrition. Our SaaS platform is recognized in the space for bringing state-of-the art efficiencies and real-time transparency into schools, all while remaining focused on the bigger outcome - helping K-12 students. Titan’s founders are school information technology veterans who have not only created a scalable and affordable solution but have also brought value into schools by delivering real results. As we continue to sky rocket within this industry, we need a Business Analyst to join our growing team and help us get there! We’re looking for someone who can see the larger opportunities within a startup, move at a fast pace and face a problem head on. If that sounds like your bread and butter, then APPLY HERE! **This position is available for remote employment in the United States and does require the team member to be on call** WHERE YOU WILL BE IN A YEAR: DRIVE PRODUCT! - You are crucial to the team and product. You will be the voice of the stakeholder and liaison to the engineering team. ACCELERATE YOUR CAREER! - You will be involved in an industry that is unlike any other. You will document and build agile requirements and improve an already existing high traffic system. Working in this fast-paced field will expand your horizons and put you far above your peers.  DRIVE TECHNICAL IMPROVEMENTS! - You will help evaluate the user experience and drive direction towards an awesome customer experience. WHAT YOU’LL DO:  * Collaborate with key stakeholders on understanding and defining application defects, improvements and/or new projects * Gather and document business and technical requirements for improvements and/or new projects * Ensure the backlog is stocked and bugs are scrubbed * Work directly with and be the voice of the stakeholders in prioritizing backlog work  * Work directly with the engineering team to communicate the vision of the stakeholders * Create design mockups using wireframe and prototyping software * Design user experiences that are scalable and ensure standards and best practices are being used * Ensure a common user experience throughout the application * Work directly with our QA team to ensure user acceptance tests are understood WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO GET THERE:  * Minimum 2 years experience as a business analyst  * 2 years experience designing user flows for web based products * 2 years experience working with a product team in defining technical requirements * 1 year experience working directly with engineers on requirement clarifications * Strong experience building user stories and use cases * Strong experience wire framing and prototyping software * Strong experience serving as liaison between stakeholders and engineering teams * Experience in conceptual modeling with the ability to see the big picture and envision possible solutions * Experience working with a agile engineering team(breaking work into iterative chunks) * Experience with all aspects of the software development life-cycle methodology and basic project management concepts * Ability to communicate complex requests in a consolidated and easy to consume format WHAT WE OFFER: At Titan School Solutions, we’re looking for bright, independent, self-motivated, and experienced people who have an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for technology. Our compensation packages consist of salary and a full suite of benefits to support our growing team.  This position is available for remote employment in the United States and does require the team member to be on call. * Competitive salary: Based on experience and performance. * Health/Benefits: Medical, Dental, & Visual. 95% paid by employer! * Unlimited PTO: We believe in work/life balance to reward our rock stars for delivering great results.  * 401K: We offer 100% upto 5% of salary. * The Right Gear: All the bells and whistles you need to drive results. * Ownership: You’ll be a crucial member of the initial build-out team, offering unlimited opportunity for growth and professional development.

items.title: Biomed Startup Co-founder
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Product


Finding funding for scientific research and completing the necessary applications is time-consuming. Hiring in this industry is difficult, largely due to the high degree of specialisation for projects. Founded and shaped by scientists, Lit Lab gives researchers the resources that they need to further their career, helping to fund research and find talent.


 


Team 


I’m a doctor and as the founder of Lit Lab I’m looking for a technical co-founder. Competence with Java and Python is essential. The candidate should also be an exceptional problem-solver and have a strong bias towards action - i.e. gets shit done! An equal equity split is available for the right candidate who is prepared to share the capital investment. Otherwise equity will be adjusted to reflect risk. Development will be done remotely with regular meetings online and in person. 


 


Market


Currently Lit Lab has demoed a prototype to a lab with a research focus on cancer genetics. This validated the idea, indicating that we’re trying to solve a compelling problem. The initial market for the web app is researchers in the biomedical sciences. However, our user interviews have identified a need across other disciplines including the physical sciences. If you fancy a crazy ride leading a startup that will help researchers change lives then I look forward to reading your CV.


 


Dr Raj Parmar, MBBS BSc

items.content:
Community Growth & Engagement Manager


About We Are In Beta


We - the education community - Are In Beta - always learning.


We Are In Beta is a digital learning content production company working towards a brighter education system. Supported by Teach First, The Young Foundation and Super Being Labs, we are an award-winning, teacher-led organisation. Having completed a round of funding, we now want to focus on building a team that helps us carry out our mission.



  • We believe there is a huge amount to be positive about in education, despite the negative headlines. So we give schools a voice and a platform to share it.



  • We believe the solutions to growth are within our schools already. So we unlock them and share them at scale to ensure the next generation’s potential is limitless.



  • We believe in the power of community. So we are building a community of schools, leaders and teachers who learn from each other to reimagine education.


Who are we looking for?


We’re looking for an awesome Community Engagement & Growth Manager, with an indefatigable curiosity about education and social justice. One with intelligent empathy for the people working in it and desire to serve and delight them. Someone who also believes in the power of positivity, growth and community.


You’ll work closely with the CEO/Founder to design and deliver our community engagement and growth strategy, which places practicing educators at its heart and drives educational improvement.


We’re not just looking for someone who is interested in helping us create a bold and challenging approach that’s currently missing in education, but someone who is an active voice in the room as we shape our proposition as we grow.


The questions you will be finding answers to in this role?


You’ll be asking these crucial questions, all with educational improvement and policy change as our goals:


1. Who is our community? What do they need? How do we serve them?


2. How do we build the richest people-centred CRM in education that enables us to make connections between our community and give back to them?


3. How do we grow our community to enhance the power of it for a brighter educational future?


Responsibilities in more detail:



  • Reading and truly understanding what teachers, leaders and the We Are In Beta community (listeners, followers and schools) are saying and feeling - via social media, calls, meetings and events.



  • Researching topics and powerful success stories that haven’t yet been told so we can all learn from them (using publicly available data sets/research reports, community recommendations, relationships with partners, social media, and conferences/events).



  • Serving the We Are In Beta community by giving schools a voice and championing them through our platform/channels so they can be heard and catalyse peer to peer learning.



  • Understanding, analysing and managing the community using a CRM and other digital marketing platforms.



  • Building deep and lasting relationships with schools and connecting members of the community with each other and/or with existing services that are better placed to support them.



  • Growing the We Are In Beta community by designing and implementing loyalty and membership programmes and benefits.



  • Engaging deeply, managing closely and growing quickly the community using social media - Twitter/LinkedIn/etc.



  • Mapping and building relationships with key stakeholders in the education community (schools, listeners/followers, grassroots organisations, local education authorities & opportunity areas, service providers, existing networks, multi academy trusts, teaching school alliances) to find stories, help them meet their goals, amplify their voices and secure distribution channels.



  • Working with the content production team to produce and tell stories and communicate what the community is feeling in a way that truly serves them.



  • Combining a data driven approach with a passion for multimedia content and story telling to serve the community.



  • Designing and communicating campaigns/activities/communications that serve, support and delight the WAIB community.



  • Writing regular reports/blogs/articles/newsletters/communications.



  • Setting goals and analysing and reporting performance against them.



  • Researching and developing commercial opportunities and raising funding.



  • Building, managing and maintaining relationships with partners and clients as We Are In Beta grows.


 


Who are you?


A values-driven educationalist: Shared values with We Are In Beta (see below. Knowledgeable and passionate about education, policy and social justice. An interest in and desire to make a difference and influence education policy. A background in teaching would be amazing but not essential.


Curious and empathetic: Empathy for and curiosity about schools, teachers, leaders, parents and students. Sensitive and creatively responsive to people’s needs. Passion for serving and supporting others to meet their goals.


Entrepreneurial, innovative and flexible: Thrive in a fast-paced, autonomous (but supportive) startup environment, proactive and happy to get stuck in and work flexibly within a small team. Have an innovative and entrepreneurial mindset - you’re joining a mission-driven start-up so you’ll have a chance to be part of it from the beginning of our story. Willingness to do things differently and embrace new technologies.


A relationship builder: Comfortable building and maintaining relationships - both those beginning with warm introductions and those with cold approaches. Ability to negotiate with partners, clients and funders.


An organised record keeper and project manager: Obsessed with being organised, keeping records and tracking progress. Ability to manage time, numerous tasks on multiple projects and prioritise objectives without getting flustered.


Analytical but also a content-minded story teller: Interested in trends and patterns in data and behaviour. Combined with ability to unearth powerful stories about particular topics that can inspire change beneath data. Critical reader of the press and existing content with an ability to see what’s missing or not being talked about and have ideas about how to make it more useful for teachers.


A feedback-embracing learner in pursuit of excellence: Enjoy collaborating, embrace feedback and seek others’ viewpoints. As comfortable asking for help as you are expressing your challenges to an approach being taken to ensure success. Get pleasure from going the extra mile and doing a phenomenal job. Looking for a role with room to grow that comes with the ability to shape the direction of an organisation.


 


What experience and track record do you have?


Community engagement and growth/memberships: Building an audience and keeping them engaged. Launching loyalty and membership programmes and benefits. Mapping key organisations, partners and people within a sector. Developing and maintaining partnerships.


Customer Relationship Management (CRM): Building and working with CRMs e.g. Hubspot. Updating, managing and analysing community databases using technology.


Social media: Using social media to research, communicate and build relationships - Twitter and LinkedIn. Tracking and analysing your performance, using data to iterate and improve.


Researching: Identifying topics and stories within them by. Researching using a number of different sources: print, online, academic research, national data sets, impact reports and social media.


Writing: Skilled at writing in a broad range of styles for different audiences: blogs, articles, journalism, impact reports, funding applications.


 


What will you get bonus points for?


Webinars: Planning, managing and hosting webinars. Setting topics, inviting guests, quality assuring materials and content.


Fundraising: Researching funding opportunities, developing relationships with funders and writing funding applications.


SEO: Experience with keyword research.Tagging and adding metadata to blogs and post. Analysing performance, iterating and improving.


 


The We Are In Beta Values



  • The 5 powerful story-telling Ps - positivity, personality, practicality, pioneering, plurality. We are here as the antidote to mainstream negativity about education. We are here to inspire others by showing what’s possible. To unpack how schools, teachers and leaders have succeeded. If they did it differently, and we can too, even better. We recognise no one approach is a silver bullet.



  • Growth and learning - We make content for and about people whose job it is to make learning happen. We are making it so they can learn themselves. To do this well, we must always be hungry to learn, be curious and ask questions to achieve excellence.



  • Community - The answers are within us and can be applied when they are shared by making connections. We galvanise our community around our mission by sharing our knowledge, expertise and contacts. The more we share, the stronger our community will be. We will gain strength by lifting others.



  • Diversity - We are committed to being an inclusive organisation with a diverse team. This extends to the guests we have in our stories, programmes and events, who must be reflective of our society.



  • Vulnerability - The most compelling content is made, and deepest learning happens, when people allow themselves to be vulnerable. We must strive to be vulnerable ourselves and encourage our community to do the same.



  • Service - Everything we do must serve our audience and the members of our community. If it doesn’t serve them, we don’t do it.



  • Change - until now teachers and leaders haven’t been given a platform that invites everyone to tune into. We are here to amplify their voices so they can be heard in a way that informs and improves policy.


What are the benefits?



  • Opportunity to work within an early-stage, mission-driven organisation and shape its direction and make a difference.



  • Competitive salary £25,000-£35,000 dependent on experience plus founding team EMI options for the right candidate



  • 25 days holiday



  • Exposure to the most inspirational and impactful leaders and teachers in the country



  • Flexible working culture/flexible working hours



  • Workplace pension



  • Project-based or part-time contract based on performance milestones for the right candidate


Location: London


Timeline:



  • Deadline for applications: midnight Sunday 10th November



  • First interviews: Week beginning Monday 18th November



  • Second interview: Week beginning Monday 25th November



  • Notification of decision: Week beginning Monday 2nd December



  • Start date: as soon as possible


How do you apply?


Please apply with the following no later than Sunday 10th November at midnight:


1. A covering letter (one side) outlining how your values, knowledge, skills and experience meet the requirements of the role


2. Your CV including references (maximum two sides)


3. The job title in the subject of your message.


4. In the body of your message: confirmation of where you saw the job role; confirmation of your current salary and notice period; whether you have the right to work in the UK and a valid criminal check with the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS); any links to any portfolios/bodies of work you have completed in the past to demonstrate what you are capable of (this could be reports, writing, performance figures, social media campaigns, articles, videos); and indication of whether your availability will be limited during the recruitment period.


No agencies please.


Read how We Are In Beta started here: https://weareinbeta.substack.com/subscribe


Other organisations might call this role Head of Membership, Community Engagement Manager, Director of Network Development, Network Manager, Community Experience Manager, Membership Development Manager.

Share job

items.title: Chili Piper: Product Manager
items.content:
Product Manager

The goal of our product team is to make delightful, enterprise-grade products delightful to use on a day by day basis at work


Our users are sophisticated employees of highly successful companies (like Square, Twillio, Airbnb and many other companies we can’t even name ) and we want them to be surprised by easy, yet powerful tools that can make their work easier


We started with a calendar that helps them get more client meetings in their calendar and we are now bringing them a delightful experience in many more areas of their workday 

Qualifications

We are looking for a rockstar product manager:

  • Who loves building complex products that engage users
  • Who understands how to take highly complex data and turn it into actionable insights 
  • Loves to be challenged by enterprise-grade problems 
  • Is very very passionate about every small detail in a product and always dedicated to improving their craft 
  • Loves a good scrum and neatly organized kanbans 
  • Has experience in managing complex products 

Ideally, you already have experience with CRMs and Marketing Automation tools.


How We Work

  • Freedom and flexibility. We’re a 100% distributed team working from around the world. Our team members can work from wherever they want in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.
  • Solve interesting problems. The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.
  • Autonomy and ownership. Working on a distributed team means you don’t have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure you’re getting things done. We’re a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.
  • Be helpful. Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

items.content:
Product Manager at Veeqo

Remote
About Veeqo

Veeqo is an award winning high growth tech start-up company which has customers around the world and with ambitions to become the best platform for ecommerce retailers to manage their business. It allows small/medium ecommerce companies the chance to give an Amazon-like experience to their customers by helping them optimise their inventory and shipping.

Veeqo is growing at 100% per year and is expanding globally. Joining Veeqo is a unique opportunity to get involved in a world-class start up. With offices in London, Swansea, Austin, Bishkek, and a large part of our team are remote.

We recently raised $5m from one of the top London VC’s, Octopus, and we are using the funds to expand the team with the best talent we can find.

The Role

You will identify and execute on the biggest opportunities to drive Veeqo’s new product-led growth strategy. You’ll use a combination of quantitative results, qualitative research and customer insights to identify high friction areas during the user onboarding / activation journey, develop solutions and achieve KPI targets. We measure the following KPIs: number of ecommerce retailers who sign up, execute key activities and complete self-onboarding.

Working closely with 2+ engineers, you will also collaborate with UX designers, product marketers, other core product managers and a leadership team that cares strongly about product-led growth.

How you will work:
  • You are scientific in your approach. You’re curious, highly analytical and data-informed in decision making. You ask five whys before you are satisfied. You measure results and iterate until the KPI targets are achieved
  • You understand the need for speed at a startup. Perfect is the enemy of good, whether it be in user research or developing features. You prefer to make improvements through rapid iterations
  • Proven ability to learn quickly in ambiguous environments
  • Excellent written and spoken communication in English. You’re able to collaborate, persuade and manage cross-team stakeholders at a remote-first workplace
Role requirements
  • 1-2 years of work experience. A bonus if the experience is in Product-adjacent domains (e.g. engineering, design, data science, analytics, product marketing, marketing, sales)
  • Previous Product experience is a plus, but not mandatory. Much more important is potential and ability to learn quickly
  • Overlap a few hours a day with UK timezone
Benefits we provide:
  • Salary up to £45,000 / $55,000 USD / $75,000 CAD
  • Be part of a fast growing start-up and make a difference
  • Vacation: 33 working days per year
  • Paid sick leaves
  • Work in a friendly, cross-functional team, with people who aim to be the best and love to tackle problems
  • Working visa and relocation to the United Kingdom for you and your family if you wish to move
  • Relaxed and flexible work environment with free hot and cold drinks, Spotify Premium and gym membership
  • Share options
Apply for job

items.title: Script Analyst
items.content:
Script Analyst at Coverfly

Remote | International

REMOTE

READING

PER CONTRACT / REMOTE

Seeking readers to evaluate and give notes on screenplays.

Pay is per submission, and usually averages $12-$18 per hour, depending on the coverage package requested and how fast you work. Job is telecommute, so you work from home or wherever you are. Hours are completely flexible – work as much or as little as you want.

The ideal candidate…

  • Loves reading – You will be reading short film scripts, screenplays, and TV pilot scripts
  • Loves writing – After reading the script, you will be writing anywhere from 1.5 – 7 pages of notes indicating areas where the script can be improved, areas where the writer has succeeded, and what steps can be taken to bring the script to its fullest potential
  • Loves movies – Knowledge of current film and television trends, as well as the basic framework and structure of screenwriting is essential
  • Is good at organizing thoughts and breaking things down into components – You will be breaking down the different elements in the script (character, plot, concept, dialogue, etc.) and addressing how they complement and influence each other
  • Has a supportive and engaging style of writing – The notes need to be clear, concise, thoughtful and actionable. The writer must be able to follow your thoughts, understand what their next steps are to improve the script, and must feel safe enough that they don’t become defensive and feel attacked by an overly-critical judge.
  • Is detail-oriented – Coverage must be presented professionally, must not contain typos or content errors, and must be grammatically clear and exhibit intuitive reasoning.
  • Is kind but honest – It can be very intimidating to submit your work to be judged. The ideal candidate will be able to provide detailed, actionable notes about changes that can be made to improve the script, while simultaneously helping the writer to feel supported. Writers should feel that the reader is “on their side”, is excited about the potential of the project, and is committed to supporting the writer and working with them to make their script exceptional

Preferred but not required…

  • Industry or reader experience with a production company, management company or agency, as well as experience with any publishing houses, literary agencies or literary magazines
  • Experience as an editor
  • Teaching experience
  • Understanding of human psychology
Apply for job

items.title: UX Product Designer
items.content:
UX Product Designer at Glofox

Remote | International
  • REMOTE
  • Product
  • Dublin, County Dublin, Ireland
  • Full time

Description

Who we are

Glofox is on a mission to revolutionize the boutique fitness industry. We are doubling in size every year, and along with our ever-growing client base that spans 30 distinct countries, our team is dedicated to taking group fitness to the next level.

We’re a hard-working, fun-loving, get-things-done type of team that are building a platform that saves time, increases retention and ultimately, helps studio and gym owners become more successful. We provide custom-branded mobile apps and integrations that make our customers’ businesses more recognisable and strive to offer best in class member experience.

At Glofox, we love entrepreneurs because we are entrepreneurs. We know how much grit it takes to start your own business and grow it into something that lasts. We roll our sleeves up, we act fast, and we learn together. We’re looking for people that will do the same.

About You

We are looking for a talented, passionate and curious UX Product Designer to join our cross-functional Product Team. You’ll be helping design our powerful software solutions – web applications and native mobile apps – to help fitness entrepreneurs succeed.

We want someone who is excited and passionate about joining our journey, someone with excellent knowledge of UX design who’s always keen to learn more about any of the dimensions of design – research, testing, prototyping etc. We don’t expect you to be an expert in everything, but have the initiative to experiment and willingness to learn!

We want you to care deeply about understanding what our customers really need, help us solve the big problems and deliver value to fitness entrepreneurs worldwide.

The impact of the role should not be underestimated – you’ll own work across our suite of products, helping millions of people get healthier and entrepreneurs succeed at their dream.

What you’ll be doing

  • Turning complex problems into simple, engaging and accessible solutions across web and mobile platforms.
  • Work through design problems partnering with the engineering and product teams
  • You’ll rely on qualitative and quantitative data to solve our customers’ problems, explore concepts and ship solutions
  • You’ll measure the impact of your decisions and work with cross-functional teams to improve existing solution
  • You’ll actively contribute to discovery and design processes at Glofox
  • Test concepts with users, conduct contextual research and design research
  • Design detailed wireframes, workflows and interactions
  • Collaborate with your colleagues in continuously refining the product architecture advocating for the best possible customer experience
  • You’ll balance competing priorities and tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Requirements

What skills you’ll need

  • You have experience working as a UX / Product Designer at digital agencies, startups or in-house
  • You have experience in user-centered design best practices
  • You’re experienced in user research methodologies and can educate others
  • You have excellent experience in creating interactive prototypes
  • You have worked on digital products and mobile app design experience – not only websites – and you have a portfolio that shows it.
  • You’ve contributed to multiple stages of the design process
  • You’re customer-centric – you always design what’s best for the people using your product
  • You’re data-informed and have used insights to make design decisions
  • You balance creative and analytical thinking and have a keen interest in the entire design process, from initial UX research and concept to iterating on the fine details.
  • You take feedback well and use it to make your work more effective

Benefits

What you’ll get

  • The chance to work at a hyper-growth venture-backed startup in an exciting industry
  • The opportunity to feel true purpose in your efforts by powering fitness entrepreneurs, making them successful and enabling them to improve the health of people on a global stage
  • Autonomy to make what you will; a team, a product or even just a way of doing things
  • Competitive compensation with share options
  • We use Apple MacBooks, but we’re happy to get you whatever equipment you need to get work done
  • Taxsaver tickets and BikeToWork scheme
  • Free monthly Gym and fitness studio usage
  • Any support you need to level up your skills – conferences, books, screencasts
  • We embrace flexible, remote work and have a distributed team across multiple countries
Apply for job

items.content:
Principal Analyst at Mediafly

Remote
  • Consulting & Advisory Services
  • Remote

Mediafly is seeking a Principal Analyst to join our team. The Principal Analyst must have extensive financial modeling (cost-benefit/ROI/TCO) experience. Client and project management, technology, and financial analysis experience is preferred, and experience working in a fast-paced environment is a plus. Mediafly offers leading business value selling tools for B2B solution providers. This person will report to the VP of Advisory & Consulting Services. This is a remote work opportunity.

Responsibilities

  • Work with clients to drive requirements, develop custom models, and update existing business case models as new research or data requires
  • Support sales efforts including demonstrations of work examples and pre-sales discussion of tool content in online presentations and occasional onsite visits.
  • Support training efforts including development and delivery of customized instructor-led training classes and online webinars.
  • Develop financial models to quantify the value of solutions
  • Extensive use of Microsoft Excel to create business cases
  • Test and validate the work of others in peer reviews
  • Manage project requirements, communications, schedules, risks, and deliverables

Qualifications

  • 10+ years of work experience in financial analysis and project management
  • Deep Microsoft Excel and Word knowledge required
  • Good understanding of key financial indicators (ROI, NPV, IRR, Payback, Break-Even, and Financial Statements)
  • Demonstrated project management capabilities
  • Technology and financial analysis experience is preferred
  • Ability to handle multiple projects at once
  • Work collaboratively with peers and Principal staff
  • MBA Preferred
  • Understanding of HTML and JavaScript a plus
Apply for job

items.title: Senior Product Designer
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=10, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=16}
items.content:
Senior Product Designer

full-time

Hours: 22.5-38 hours a week depending on your preferences and availability

Timezone: Remote with at least 3 hours of overlap with UTC+10 mornings (you’ll be working with people in Vancouver, Perth, and Melbourne)

As a Senior Product Designer at Buildkite you’ll work on a small team with a big impact, and help shape a tool that thousands of developers use every day. You’ll report to Tim Lucas, our co-founder and design lead, and you’ll be working alongside an existing senior product designer and print designer. In this small team you’ll have the chance to influence all corners of Buildkite’s product and brand.

A typical day for a Senior Product Designer might look like:
  • Pairing with a product engineer on Zoom to talk through a new feature being worked on, and working on improvements to UI, copy, and user flows.
  • Mocking up user interface ideas in Sketch or Figma, and posting them to Basecamp, to help clarify discussions between everyone on the team.
  • Collaborating on a scope doc for a new feature, and helping to explore the possible solutions and tradeoffs.
  • Helping polish a new UI animation, pairing with a frontend engineer over Zoom.
  • Writing a post to the team on Basecamp with some design strategies and ideas, and getting feedback from a range of perspectives on the team.
  • Giving feedback on and helping to iterate our UI component libraries, helping to empower the rest of the team with great design tools.
  • Creating polished design assets for product launches, and designing changes to the Buildkite marketing site.
  • Joining in the weekly design catchup over Zoom, giving feedback on a commissioned illustration project for a new conference sticker, contributing to a sponsorship booth design idea, and demonstrating designs you’ve been working on.
  • Pairing on support to answer customer questions, and venturing into the far corners of Buildkite’s product, tools and documentation to understand how things are working in practice.
This job is for you if you have:
  • An eye for detail, and feel comfortable advocating for the user through the lens of great design.
  • The ability to navigate ambiguity, create clarity through design, and lead by example.
  • Experience working closely with frontend and backend engineers, and enjoy participating in the process of bringing your design ideas to life.
  • An interest in working in remote, cross-functional teams.
  • Worked on an existing product, helping to iterate it towards an overarching vision.
  • Confidence to seek critical feedback, ask questions, and participate in decision making.
  • Experience with leading discussions about tradeoffs in the product development process, and helping to ensure a cohesive product experience in the face of challenges.
  • An interest in helping build a small company with big impact, and influencing many aspects of the business with great design.
  • Proficiency in Sketch, Figma, Illustrator, or other design tools.
  • Basic proficiency in HTML and CSS.
  • Basic proficiency working with Ruby on Rails or similar web app framework.
Benefits and Salary
  • Salary of AUD$130K-$160K (US$90-$110K, €80-100K) depending on experience, plus benefits, for 38 hours per week (pro-rata for part-time). Salary amount excludes superannuation / 401k.
  • Equity and profit share.
  • 6 weeks paid annual leave.
  • 6 months paid parental leave for primary caregivers, and 3 months paid parental leave for secondary carers with superannuation/401k and continuation of all benefits.
  • Comprehensive hardware and phone budget every 24 months.
  • Training and conference budget.
  • Wellness budget.
  • Private healthcare.
  • Green commuting budget.
  • Expense card.
  • Home office expenses, and co-working budget.
About us

Buildkite is a continuous delivery platform that helps development teams ship quality code, fast. Making developers happy and productive makes us happy, and we’re lucky to work closely with some of the best software teams in the world, including Airbnb, Shopify, Wayfair, Intercom, PagerDuty, and Basecamp.

We are an independently owned, profitable company that values sustainable growth, transparency and work-life balance. We’re currently a distributed team of twelve, and work remotely from Vancouver, Perth, Sydney, Adelaide and Melbourne.

Read more about us at https://buildkite.com/careers

Apply for this job ↬

items.title: Senior Product Manager
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Buyapowa is a technology company based in London, with offices in Paris and Vancouver. We operate the leading global refer-a-friend platform, which allows brands and retailers to identify their biggest advocates, then motivates and rewards them for introducing new customers. Plugging seamlessly into an existing website or app, the Buyapowa platform does more than merely ask customers to refer their friends - it incentivises and equips them to share again and again.

Since launching in 2011, Buyapowa has worked with over 100 of the world’s largest brands and retailers, including Sprint, Gap, Vodafone, First Direct, Expedia, Telefonica and BT. Following the acquisition of Canada’s RewardStream in 2018, Buyapowa is well positioned for strong growth in the North American market and beyond.

Globally, we’re a team of 40 employees and we’re growing quickly. We’ve won awards both for our technology and our work with clients. And we’re passionate about what we do - so we like to get things done - but, at the same time, we have fun as a team and thrive off each other’s energy.

The role:

We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to help define and deliver our product innovation vision. You’ll translate ideas into strategy and features, and follow product development from start to finish. You’ll be a perceptive and creative leader, understand how to exploit data and have experience managing a B2B SaaS product.

What you will do:

  • Develop and implement a product portfolio that aligns with the company vision
  • Work with senior management to create and articulate the product innovation roadmap
  • Be the voice of the customer and champion of good product practices within the company
  • Collect and analyse feedback from clients, end-users, sales team and stakeholders
  • Partner with our product designer to shape exceptional product experiences
  • Produce appropriately detailed product development stories
  • Manage and effectively prioritise multiple backlogs
  • Coordinate multiple cross-functional development teams in two countries
  • Ensure product releases are managed and communicated correctly
  • Plan, run and extract insights from experiments and AB tests
  • Own the product KPIs ensuring that we understand our status and progress at all times
  • Provide the sales team with effective product collateral
  • Produce accurate and usable client documentation

You have:

  • Proven experience as a Product Manager for a B2B SaaS product
  • Experience as the sole product person within a fast growing startup
  • Ability to communicate your product decisions to all levels of the organisation
  • Ability to recognise and describe what a good user experience looks like
  • Product marketing experience for an enterprise SaaS product
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
  • Familiarity with Agile ways of working
  • Ideally worked on products with enterprise clients
  • Ideally worked with remote development teams (we are split between London & Vancouver)

Why you’ll love us:

  • You’ll be part of a small, competent and highly ambitious team
  • You will own initiatives and have the autonomy to execute your plan
  • Be part of a rapidly growing business expanding internationally
  • A Perks@Work account for significant discounts on products, experiences and things like gym membership
  • Excellent tax-efficient equity scheme

items.title: Senior Analyst - Power BI and DAX - Remote Based
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=6, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content: What you will do: The Senior Analyst will be responsible for designing reports and analytic solutions, gathering reporting requirements and documenting business processes as needed. The analyst will handle ad-hoc data requests, develop dashboards and scorecards in Power BI, complex reports using SSAS and SSRS, write SQL/T-SQL queries and make sure the output data meets expectations. The analyst will work independently with users to collect enterprise and customer reporting requirements and manage timelines and expectations. Also engages with other teams, departments and stakeholders to make sure all the reporting solution development requirements are well documented, fully understood and delivered per expectations. The analyst will perform data mining, trend/predictive analysis and statistical analysis leading to decision support capabilities. How you will do it: • Design and develop Scorecards and Dashboards using Power BI and other data visualization tools for various organizational metrics and KPIs. • Create new reports and modify existing reports using industry standards and best practices. • Perform ad-hoc data analysis and manual data refreshes. • Elicit business requirements from Subject Matter Experts using interviews, document analysis and requirements workshops. • Use the gathered requirements to develop logic for reporting, analytics or IT application support. • Develop manual/automated reporting programs using data from in-house systems or other data marts. • Creates reports using SQL Server Reporting Services environment with an In-depth understanding of the report life cycle. • Perform statistical analysis, build predictive models, and formulate decision models that relate operational activities to results; to drive value stream enhancement and continuous improvement. • Understand data standards and identify data abnormalities. Instill data quality in all solutions delivered. • Engage with IT to transform existing solutions to new methodology and technology. Liaise with IT to manage process of data mapping, UAT testing, etc. • Maintain close alignment with all customers (internal, external) What we look for: • Bachelor degree or higher from a reputed university in engineering, IT, economics, math, statistics, science or other related fields in quantitative or analytical discipline. • Minimum 3 years of experience in related business analyst or data/reporting analyst roles. SKILLS: Exceptional Power BI and DAX Skills • Excellent skill level in SQL, PL/SQL. • In-depth experience with Microsoft analytics Stack (SQL Server, SSAS Tabular, Power Query, Power BI, DAX, SQL and T-SQL) o Proficient in DAX, M language. o Experience in Extraction, and Transformation and Loading (SSIS) o Experience in Tabular/OLAP Model (Microsoft SSAS) • In-depth experience with Associated Development Tools - Visual Studios Data Tools, SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Data Tools, Microsoft TFS. • Knowledge of working with database client tools such as Toad. • Knowledge of Data Mining, Clustering & Statistical Modelling (preferred). • Experience with Azure Machine Learning (AML). Understanding of Azure and its data services. • R programming & Python. • Database Design. Excellent skill level in relational database required. Oracle, MS SQL Server knowledge. • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and O365. • Superior documentation and organizational skills. Must be detail¬ oriented. • Excellent critical-thinking skills with the ability to research and analyze data retrieved from multiple sources •Must possess and demonstrate excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communications skills. • Must be an adaptable self-starter and work with minimal supervision. Must be able to handle multiple projects and organize time effectively. • Must be willing to put in extra time and effort if need be. Go above and beyond the requirements of the job and strive to exceed expectations. Role can be remote-based. Johnson Controls is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit

items.content: Our client is currently seeking a Senior Technical Product Manager- MN and REMOTE Job Description: 1 contractor will work onsite at times. The rest can be telecommute, can sit anywhere in US. Responsibilities: Support production deployment process and defects Support Operations business areas for deployments Performing hands-on Quality Assurance and/or User acceptance testing for production defects Assisting with reporting requirements, and pulling reports for functionality Performing hands-on Quality Assurance and/or User acceptance testing in a web application environment testing User Interface, Database, Web services Working with complex XML/JSON, EDI X12, SQL transactions Working with the UNIX operating system and writing SQL scripts Working in an Agile ATDD environment Working closely with Developers and Architects in solving software defects What software tools/skills are needed to perform these daily responsibilities? Scripting/coding experience on Java automation testing tools such as Java, Selenium, and Cucumber or other similar tools which uses object oriented programs Hands-on testing experience working with complex XML/JSON, EDI X12, SQL transactions Hands-on experience working with UNIX operating system and writing SQL scripts What skills/attributes are a must have? Bachelor's degree in engineering or equivalent work experience 5 years of Quality Assurance testing experience in a web application environment testing User Interface, Database, Web services, API's, Batch/ETL components 4 years of experience writing test plans and test cases 5 years of hands-on scripting/coding experience in any one of the below Java automation testing tools such as, Cucumber, Selenium and Java, or other similar tools which uses object oriented programs 5 years of hands-on testing experience working with complex XML/JSON, EDI X12, SQL transactions 2 years of hands-on experience working with UNIX operating system and writing SQL scripts Exposure to agile software development methodologies Prior experience in working closely with Developers and Architects in solving software defects Experience in creating and implementing testing methodologies, processes to solve testing problem in hand Preferred skill set: Experience working within a Clinical organization, projects, or department with basic Health industry experience Experience with the prior authorization processes Any of the following : RN, BSN, PA, LPN Shift Start/End Time: Mon-Fri 8-5 (Some OT nights and weekend will be required) will be discussed in interview

items.title: Product Designer
items.content:
Filestage

Product Designer

verified
Worldwide
# About Us At [Filestage](https://filestage.io) we believe that broken workflows poison teams with miscommunication, friction, and frustration. Our mission is to fuel creative teams with a rock-solid workflow. With our software, we empower people to produce great results together and build healthy and meaningful relationships at work. Over 500 companies (and growing!) all over the world like Lufthansa, Canadian Tire or Rabobank benefit from happier and more productive employees with Filestage. We work hard to build great things together—and make time to celebrate our accomplishments. # Responsibilities **You play a key role in defining and building the future of our product.** This is an opportunity to have a big impact and to shape how we simplify the daily work-life of thousands of professionals. **You drive product solutions that service the goals of both the users and the company.** You’re collaborating closely with product and engineering teammates to work on the strategy and execution of features. **You create an outstanding user experience for product improvements.** You conduct user research, design user flows, create visual designs, and measure the success of your improvements. **You run product experiments** in cross-functional squads to achieve business, product and user goals. **You build strong relationships** with our community of passionate customers to dive deep into their pain points, needs and use cases. # Requirements **You have a holistic understanding of product design.** You have more than 3 years of professional experience in product or UX design and can't wait to learn more. **You work well with lots of questions and few answers.** No problem is too big or too hard. You take ownership and are able to bring things to completion in strong collaboration with your teammates. **You’re hungry to learn** and strive to continuously improve, iterate, and integrate what you learn. **You’re a strong communicator** and have experience collaborating with a distributed team. **You have empathy and resilience.** You have empathy for our customers, to build a product they’ll love. You have empathy for our coworkers, to build a workplace we’ll love. And resilience to be able to take feedback from anywhere, consider it gracefully, and fold it into your thinking and your work. # This is what you get **Work from where you are happiest and enjoy a flexible day schedule**. We are a fully distributed team, working from different locations and time zones, each individual following their personal daily schedule. **Work with teammates across the world. **At Filestage, you broaden your horizons and build relationships with teammates around the world. **We meet up in real life.** We all travel together at least once a year at our team retreat to have fun and get to know each other. **We build and maintain a strong team culture.** Our working culture is based on our three core values: We are keen to learn, We take ownership and We play fair. **Your opinion matters.** We trust our team members to make the best decisions to achieve their goals. We don’t micromanage. **You learn and grow continuously** by solving complex problems together with highly talented minds. **Are you tired of useless meetings and slow decision making? **We have flat hierarchies, no bullshit meetings and iterate quickly. #Location - Worldwide

items.title: Senior SaaS B2B Product Designer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
items.content:
DL Remote

Senior Saas B2B Product Designer

verified
Europe+ (CET +/- 3 hours)
DL-remote.com is a european recruiting platform for the best software engineers, data scientists, product managers & designers, devops or growth experts who want to work in permanent full-time remote positions at top companies. We strongly believe that remote work engagements offer more freedom, more productivity, and as a result, lead to better outcomes. Done right, these jobs make people happier, companies more productive, and our environment more healthy. We want to enable those long-term remote work engagements by matching the right talent with the best remote job opportunities. We currently have several opportunities @ our partner companies for SaaS product designers who have a proven track record of building outstanding digital B2B applications. # Requirements * Proven work experience as a Product Designer or similar role (min. 5 years) * Experience of 2+ years to build technical B2B applications at successful SaaS companies * Compelling Portfolio of design projects * Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Wireframe.cc and InVision) * Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe XD or Sketch * Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders * Good time-management skills * BSc in Design, Computer Science or relevant field * Proven work experience in remote team setups #Location - Europe+ (CET +/- 3 hours)

items.title: Performance Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=16, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
komoot

Performance Marketing Manager

verified
UTC-1 to UTC+3
**Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times—and, with more than 8.5 million users and 50,000 five-star reviews - komoot is on its way to become one of the most popular cycling and hiking apps. ** **Join our team and take over the responsibility for our performance marketing campaigns to acquire keen cyclists and outdoor enthusiasts around the globe!** **Why you will love it** * You’ll take over responsibility for all our paid campaigns in 10 countries from day one. * You’ll promote a product that inspires millions all over the world to get out and explore. * You’ll work in a fast-paced startup with strongly motivated and talented co-workers. * You’ll enjoy the freedom to organize yourself the way you want and work with whichever tools you love. * We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house or anywhere else that lies in any time zone situated between UTC-1 and UTC+3. * You’ll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides. # Responsibilities **What you will do** * Plan, launch, track and optimize successful app campaigns in different markets and on various ad platforms (Apple Search Ads, Google App Campaigns, social ads, …). * Test new channels and tactics (native advertising, content deep linking, remarketing, ... ) to acquire users and drive retention, engagement and conversions. * Team up with designers and copywriters to develop top quality creative and texts to target various audiences in 6 languages. * Set up A/B tests, run cohort analysis, measure the performance of your campaigns and optimize the ROI. * Team up with data analysts and engineers to improve our campaign measurement and attribution models. * Run keyword analysis and store experiments to optimize our app store performance (ASO). # Requirements **You will be successful in this position if you have** * 3+ years experience running paid campaigns for a mobile app with hands-on experience running Apple Search Ads, Google App Campaigns and social ads. * Strong organizational skills and a structured and methodical way of running and optimizing ad campaigns. * Strong analytical skills and the ability to transform data into actionable insights. * A good understanding of attribution models, cohort analyses and ROI calculation. * A good overview of mobile measurement solution and 3rd party tools. * Have solid and proven skills in SQL and Python. * Proven experience with app store and keyword optimization. #Location - UTC-1 to UTC+3

items.title: Digital Marketing Manager
items.content:
Digital Marketing Manager at Aha

Remote

Anywhere in the United States

Marketing

Do you want to help evangelize software that is changing the way people manage products and innovate? Do you love digging into data to find answers to complex questions?

As a Digital Marketing Manager at Aha!, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a self-funded and profitable company that is growing fast. Aha! was founded by a proven team of product and marketing experts. More than 250,000 users worldwide trust our roadmap software to build and market products customers love.

We are looking for someone who:

  • At least 4 years of experience managing search engine marketing at a B2B SaaS company (or equivalent)
  • Extremely strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills
  • High attention to detail and excellent written communication
  • A desire to have ownership and responsibility of vital work and measure the success of programs

We are committed to being great, and we want someone who:

  • Can work at a fast-paced company where the feedback cycle is measured in hours rather than weeks
  • Has a “get it done” attitude and a background of delivering superb work again and again
  • Is seeking a career-defining opportunity and a proven, results-oriented team which has sold multiple software companies

We are building a distributed team, and you can work from anywhere in the United States for this role. We offer generous salary, equity, benefits, and a profit-sharing program. See other openings at Aha!

Apply for job

Partner or Senior Counsel at CyberCoders

Remote

Insurance defense firm with a national platform seeks experienced attorney in Orange County. This opportunity is 100% remote. If you have 10+ years of relevant experience, we are willing to discuss bringing you on as a Partner, even if you have not been in a Partner role previously.

What’s In It for You

  • Competitive compensation plan & bonus opportunities
  • Work 100% remotely
  • Comprehensive benefits plan
  • Partner opportunity

What You Need for this Position

  • JD from an ABA approved law school
  • Admitted to practice in California
  • 5+ years of civil litigation experience, experience with personal injury defense is required

This job is open to telecommute candidates.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Preferred Skills

  • Construction Defect
  • insurance defense
